loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven began his startup business, "Youth Works Enterprises Incorporated", two months ago. This 19-year-old young man from Little Rock is a jack of all trades. Steven’s business involves cleaning construction sites, working as a handyman, washing and detailing cars, and anything else his customers are willing to pay him to do.

A few months ago, a community partner informed Steven about Accion Texas Inc. and explained to him what the nonprofit organization can do for entrepreneurs. Steven inquired and proceeded to apply for a microloan from Accion. Once he was approved, Steven began utilizing his Accion loan to buy new and updated tools, pay for fuel to travel to each job location, cover car maintenance, and print fliers to advertise door to door.

Most of his customer base is comes from word of mouth and the little advertising he does daily around the neighborhood. He currently lives with his parents but hopes to earn enough to take the leap and move out someday on his own.

loans.use: to buy new and updated tools, pay for fuel to travel to each job location, cover car maintenance, and print fliers to advertise door to door.

loans.name: Maribel Cesilia

texts.es:
Maribel es una persona bastante habilidosa en el area de la cocina, desde siempre le ha gustado preparar ricas recetas para complacer a sus comensales.

Prepara diferentes platos tipicos de la region caribe y es muy reconocida por su buena sazón.

Vive con sus dos hijos a los cuales ha intentado siempre ofrecerles lo mejor.

Solicita un prestamo para la compra de surtido, insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion de sus recetas, esto le permitirá tener sus alimentos siempre disponibles y frescos para sus clientes.

Poco a poco podra cumplir su sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a charismatic and attentive woman who runs her own business, a grocery store that she started to earn income that would help her family. She had the strength and determination to overcome adversity, pick herself up, and move forward. Her efforts have paid off in the eight years since she opened the store. 

Maria's great motivation is to keep moving forward and strengthen her business, stocking it with goods such as grains, fried snacks, sodas, and general grocery items. This investment will allow her to offer her customers higher quality and better service, boosting her sales significantly, and thus her income. 

Maria says that her overriding ambition is to keep growing her business and one day transform it into a supermarket, where customers can find whatever they need. The store would then be more profitable and allow her family to enjoy a better quality of life.  

Funding this loan means you will be supporting the efforts of Colombian women!

loans.use: Compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion de sus alimentos.

loans.name: Radio Musondolya Group

texts.en:
Mpabaisi is 59 years old and married with 15 children. He is a member of Radio Musondolya Group living in Kasese, Uganda. Mpabaisi is a teacher by profession and has been in that service for 10 years and runs a retail shop to supplement his income. Mpabaisi has a dream of expanding his business into a big sugar-selling center. Mpabaisi wants money to buy sacks of sugar to sell. 
 
He is a member of Radio Musondolya Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar to sell

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a hardworking married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Two of her children attend primary school and she cherishes that so much. She used her previous loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed. All her chicks died due to the diseases and other conditions. She now deals in the selling of general merchandise and works for many hours each day throughout the week. She has also setup a mango growing project which is doing well and that earns her additional income. Her vision is to expand all her projects that is the shop and mango project in order to tap high profits because of the available market and educate all her children though she has not been able to fulfill her dreams due to limited capital.
She needs money to buy more items like soap, biscuits, cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, biscuits, cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
The young man Juan, is 23 years old. Ever since he was little he was passionate over the auto mechanic work and since the beginning has always been his hobby, one that today has translated into his way of life. His business has allowed him to reach the goals he had planned. In 1996 he and his older brother started repairing cars on weekends in the garage of their family home. Later his older brother decided to formally set up a shop, the one that they use today. Although still a student he invested himself in his work as a mechanic. Approximately one year ago his brother died as a result of a car accident, so Juan was faced with running the business all on his own.

He has struggled to keep up the business that his brother started. His parents depend on him and the income from his business is the only source of income they have. For this, Juan requires a loan of $475 that he will use towards the purchase parts that he needs. Your genersority will be of great help to Juan and his parents. Help them. They need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Juan tiene actualmente 23 años de edad, desde pequeño le ha apasionado la mecánica y que en un principio fue su pasatiempo es ahora su modo de vida, misma que le ha permitido lograr las metas que se ha planteado. En 1996 el y su hermano mayor iniciaron reparando autos los fines de semana en el patio de su casa y posteriormente su hermano decidió poner formalmente un local, mismo que actualmente ocupan. Siendo el apenas un estudiante se incorporó al trabajo del taller y hace aproximadamente un año su hermano murió en un accidente automovilístico, por lo que Juan se quedo solo al frente del negocio.

El ha luchado mucho por mantener el proyecto que su hermano empezó, pues sus padres dependen de el y las ganancias del negocio es la única fuente de subsistencia que tienen. Por ello, Jun, requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de refacciones que necesita. Tu generosidad será de mucha ayuda para Juan y sus padres, apóyalos, el te necesita.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: H. Fikret is 45 and a successful businessman now. He opened small food store and it brought significant profit, enough to cover family needs but not enough to enlarge his market. So Fikret decided to borrow 1200 USD  from Aqroinvest CU.  He is married and has 5 children. He says, “I hope our small market will become a family business in future.”

loans.use: to enlarge his food store

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio is 26 years old, in an open relationship and has a 2-year-old son. To cover household expenses and improve the quality of life for her son, Rocio started selling shoes six years ago. She started out selling to family members and later, thanks to the simplicity of her payment plans, she increased her customer base. Fortunately today she supplies a larger number of orders and has been able to grow her business.

Currently, Rocio is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer her clients a wider selection and improve her service. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be a part of this business' development and help Rocio and her family. They are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rocio tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y después para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo Rocio se dedica a la venta de zapatos, inició hace seis años vendiendo entre sus familiares y después gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofrecía fue incrementando su número de clientes, afortunadamente hoy surte una mayor cantidad de pedidos y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Rocio necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en sólo 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a Rocio y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es:
Don Gaudencia is an elderly gentleman who still keeps his good spirit and strength to work for improving the quality of life of his family. He has the responsibility of his 4 year old grandson abandoned by his parents, who represents a motivation to continue elaborating cheese together with his loyal and loving wife.

Through his work, this tireless father gave his children the support they needed to move ahead and presently they all carry out the activities they learned due to the education they received from their parents, and today his efforts are focused on covering the esential needs of his grandson and therefore he wishes to expand his activity and optimize the production of his cheeses.

Doing this Don Gaudencio would increase his income and would spend more time with his sacrificing wife and his little one. To achieve this he asks for $350 and his plan is to pay back in 6 months. Together we can fulfill his dreams if we support don Gaudencio.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Gaudencio, a pesar de su avanzada edad aún conserva su ánimo y fortaleza para seguir trabajando con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a visto en la presencia de su nieto de 4 años, a quién abandonaron sus padres, una motivación por la cual continuar sus labores con la producción de quesos que realiza diariamente junto a su leal y querida esposa.

Este incansable padre de familia supo brindarles todo el apoyo, a través de su trabajo, a sus hijos y ahora ellos desempeñan las actividades que aprendieron gracias a la educación que les brindó cuando se encontraban acogidos en el seno de su hogar. Ahora todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos los enfoca para brindarle lo esencial y necesario a su pequeño nieto y con este objetivo en mente desea ampliar el capital de inversión en su actividad con el propósito de optimizar la producción de sus quesos. De esta manera Gaudencio podrá tener mejores ingresos y compartirá mucho mayor tiempo con su abnegada esposa y el pequeño por el cual lucha.Su solicitud es por la suma de 350 dólares y se compromete a realizar el pago en un lapso de 6 meses.Juntos podremos cristalizar los sueños de Gaudencio, brindémosle pronto nuestro apoyo.

loans.use: To optimize the process of craft production of cheese

loans.name: Atanacia

texts.en:
Antanacia M. de Torres is a 45 year old woman living with her husband and their three children in Tres de Mayo, Paraguay. Antancia´s husband is a mechanic and helps substantially with the household expenses. Of her three children one has graduated and has a job and home of his own and the other two are in high school.

Antancia has run a despensa out of her home for almost a year. A despensa is very similar to a small grocery. Her store provides a variety of basic staples to the people in her neighborhood. Before opening her despensa she sold fruit. Little by little she augmented her stock and now runs her despensa which offers everything from fruit to meat or sodas and dairy products.

For many years Antanacia was unable to work full time because she was constantly caring for her son who was in and out of hospitals. However, now that her children are older they are more independent.

With the work she puts into her store she has been able to expand quickly. She owns three different refrigeration units each for a separate item; one for drinks, another for meat and another for dairy. Her plan for her store is to continue to expand. With the money that she has asked for she will continue down this path. She tells us that meat is particularly expensive and the money will help her to purchase more.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store, including meat.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Lawn mowing is a growing business these days. Paulina is not a stranger to the SPBD program, and she hopes to use these funds to maintain her lawn mowing equipment. She makes good money from the jobs she gets and is enjoying the fruit of her labor. Thanks to you and SPBD for the help.

loans.use: To buy parts for her lawnmower

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (B Group

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old. She has a canteen for home product sales. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business. Ruth has a public pay phone and wants to use the loan to buy more air time cards. Betty has a charcoal selling business and wants to add in stock. Juliet and Specioza both have retail shops and want to increase capital.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to purchase more goods like sodas, sugar, bread and flour and to improve their various businesses.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en: Tohirjon A. is 33 years old, is married and has 3 children. Tohirjon started his business practically from scratch, but now he rents a trade outlet selling children's wear and shoes. He has six years of experience in the business. Now Tohirjon is requesting a loan to import new styles and increase his assortment.

loans.use: To increase his assortment by importing new styles

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia is a happy, persevering, and dedicated mother who works hard to keep up her home. Her immense motherly love motivates her to continue working to provide the best for her family, which is composed of her husband and 3 children. Since youth, she supported her loving parents in their work - selling livestock. Later, she married with ample experience of raising and selling livestock. Thus, she reasoned that she would continue to do the same work as her parents, which for many years, brought her good income. Despite her old age, Dionicia works with much enthusiasm like her husband, Juan, whose eagerness is his character. After many years, they have longed to build a dream home. Your indispensable support will allow Dionicia to materialize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Dionicia, es una madre alegre, perseverante y muy dedicada a las labores de su hogar, su inmenso amor de madre la motiva a seguir trabajando y poner lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante a su familia integrada por su esposo y sus 3 hijos.Desde joven que tuvo uso de razón apoyó a sus queridos padres en su actividad de comercialización de ganado, luego de contraer matrimonio, con la amplia experiencia ya ganada en esta actividad decidió con mucha más razón dedicarse a esta noble labor de comercialización de ganado, que durante muchos años le viene generando buenos ingresos económicos.Pese a su avanzada edad doña Dionicia sigue desempeñándose con mucho ahínco, en tanto su esposo, Juan, con el empeño que lo caracteriza hace lo propio en su trabajo, y entre ambos después de muchos años están logrando construir su deseada casita. “Vuestro indispensable aporte permitirá concretar los sueños de Dionicia”

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish their dream home

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. is a 38-year-old farmer who lives in Tuol Chambork Village, Kampong Cham Province. She makes about $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Thal, is a 39-year-old who makes about $2 per day. They have been farming for twenty-eight years. S. and Thal have three children, all of whom are young. S. requests a loan of $100 to purchase used goods to resell. This loan will help to add capital for their business and increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase used goods to resell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia belongs to the community bank, Las Flores of Paraíso (The Flowers of Pardise), located in Jr. Ucayali 669, Distract of Calleria, of Department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is the mother of one child. With the first loan that Virginia received from Manuela Ramos (for 300 Peruvian Soles), she decided to invest it in a small business of making clothing.

She sews all kinds of clothing. She wakes up at 7 am, to prepare breakfast for her child. From there she dedicates her time to make clothing to be able to deliver them to her customers until the late hours of the night.

With this next loan of 300 Soles, which will payoff in 4 months, she will buy: clothes for adults and kids, fabrics in diverse colors, zippers, elastics, buttons, etc.

Virginia is very happy, because her business is growing a little by little. Her sales are also increasing. All of the effort she puts into her business is so that she can give her child a good education and a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Ucayali 669, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Virginia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño negocio de confecciones.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de confecciones de ropas de todo tipo, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de allí se dedica a la confección de sus prendas para entregárselos a sus clientes hasta tardes oras de la noche.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niño, telas de diversos colores, sierres, elásticos, botones, etc.

Virginia esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas también aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darle una buena educación y futuro a su hijo.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es:
Julieta is a young lady of 18 years of age. She is very cheerful and ingenious. As soon as she finished her high school studies she immediately got started in the business of selling stuffed animals and also selling cosmetics by order. She has had success in both businesses and it is thanks to this that she is now persuing higher education at a private university in the city of Juliaca. Her economic independence has made her into a responsible woman and she is sure that with hard work she will be able to have success in life. At this time she does not have sufficient capital to invest in her cosmetics sales business, due to the fact that a few days ago she decided to invest her capital in her second-hand stuffed animal business. She requests your support so that she can continue with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Julieth, es una jovencita de 18 años, muy alegre e ingeniosa, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios inmediatamente se dedicó al negocio de peluches y venta de cosméticos de belleza por pedidos, con ambas actividades obtuvo buenos resultados, gracias a ello viene siguiendo sus estudios superiores en una Universidad Privada de la ciudad de Juliaca.Su independencia económica la ha convertido en una mujer responsable y segura de lo que con esfuerzo está dispuesta ha alcanzar en la vida, en estos momentos no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir en su negocio de venta de cosméticos de belleza, debido a que hace algunos días decidió invertir todo su capital en su negocio de venta de peluches de segundo uso.Y solicita vuestro apoyo para continuar con su labor.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can continue her business of selling cosmetics

loans.name: Sine Safou Group

texts.fr:
The Sine Safou Group consists of women from Palmarin Ngallou (Senegal), who are busy processing local soap after having undergone training and gained experience in this field. Given the high cost of local soap, we are requesting a loan to buy the soap ingredients (myrrh oil, caustic soda, shea butter, scents, dyes etc) as well as equipment (buckets, valves, molds, mixers), in order to process the soap properly and be able to sell it to  people and thus combat dermatological diseases. 
 Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.
Le groupement Sine Safou est un groupement de femmes de Palmarin Ngallou qui s'active dans la transformation du savon local après avoir subi une formation tout en ayant de l'expérience dans ce domaine. Vu la cherté du prix du savon moderne, nous sollicitons un prêt pour acheter les composants du savon (huile de myrrhe, soude caustique, beurre de karité, parfums, colorants etc) mais aussi du matériel (seaux, vannes, moules, malaxeurs) afin de faire une bonne transformation du savon et pouvoir le vendre  aux populations tout en luttant contre les maladies dermatologiques.

loans.use: Processing and sale og local soap

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan C., age 37, runs a business selling a variety of biscuits at school to earn approximately $1.60 of profit a day. Her husband is a cow dealer, earning around $10 in revenue each day. This couple has three children and all of them are students. To make the business more lucrative, Mrs. C. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase more cows for her husband's business. This will increase the family's income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for her husband's business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Pham Thi C. is 49 years old. Her husband is a soldier and is garrisoned far from home, so she is responsible for all housework and family issues. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed a loan to invest in pig raising. After 3 months, she gained a profit of VND 200,000. As a laborious woman, she continued borrowing to invest in raising pigs and plant some kinds of fruit tree. As she did these businesses, she also leant more experience from other people. That is why after joining TYM for 5 years, her businesses have improved and she now has an income of VND 2 million per month. In addition, her husband contributes his salary to the family's income, which makes her family's economy stable. Regarding the next cycle, she wants to borrow VND 19 million to invest in her fruit-tree plating business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growwing

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Edilberta es viuda, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Edilberta tiene una tienda en su casa ubicado en la asociación ciudad de cumana que se encuentra cerca al estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrote, cereales, carnes, verduras, gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche con la ayuda de sus hijas.

Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar. Los sueños de Edilberta son tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes y brindar la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Ollantay communal bank. She is a 56-year-old widow with three children. Edilberta has a shop in her home, which is located in the city of Cumana, in the Ayacucho region (of Peru), near the town stadium. With her children’s assistance, she sells groceries, cereal grains, meat, vegetables, and carbonated drinks from 5:00 in the morning till 9:00 at night. She needs a loan of $975 (3000 soles), which she will invest in the purchase of rice, oil and sugar. Edilberta dreams of having a wholesale grocery store and of providing the best education possible for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn H. is a 41-year-old farmer who lives in Koktlokler Commune, Siem Reap Province. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is married. One of her sons works for a local water company, while her husband, Mr. Khoeun Sngoun, 40, is also a farmer. The couple earns about $2 a day growing rice and vegetables. Morn has applied for a loan of $600 to buy oxen to plow her farm. This loan will make her work much easier and increase the value of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase oxen

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Mr. Sour S., 63, and his wife, Mrs. Un Mao, 61, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1964 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other son is a construction worker and weaves silk when he is free from construction work.

Sour has been a wooden house builder since he was sixteen years old, a skill he learned from his father. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was ten years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sour is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Mrs. Non N. lives in Pro Keab Village in Takeo Province. She is 49 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is a construction worker and the others attend the local school.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land, on which she cultivates rice for a living. 

Her husband, Mr. Nop Soeurn, uses his motorbike to transport goods and passengers to earn an income. He faces a problem because his bike is too old, making the passengers uncomfortable. Mrs. Non N. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarmila L. is a resident of Bholdhoka. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Raju L., works in private office. Her older son is studying in grade 4 and her younger son is studying in grade 2.

Mrs. L. is engaged running her own vegetable shop. She opened her vegetable shop 9 years ago. She opened her shop to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different kinds of green vegetables in her shop. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10,000 to invest in her shop. She is going to buy vegetables, potatoes, and others to be able to sell more. She wants to generate income and change their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy K. is an entrepreneur who is married and has two children. She runs a cosmetics shop at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the business for 10 years. She purchases her products from the wholesale shops at the Kariakoo market. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to purchase more products to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry C. grows rice for a living. He tills 3 3/4 hectares of land that he inherited from his parents. He is also a fisherman. If he is not busy on the farm, he goes out fishing to catch some fish to eat. He is 53 years old and the harvest that he gets from the farm has made it easier for him to feed and clothe his family.

He is asking for a loan of PhP 13,000 ($275) from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. In this way, he believes he will have a better yield. His harvest will be for his family's use, and the rest will be sold to rice traders in their village. 

CEVI helps people start and establish their own businesses. Through the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all their clients, more and more people are able to make their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Miel Plus Group

texts.fr: Rose M. a une petite boutique générale. Elle vend aussi des vêtements pour enfants ainsi que des pièces pour dames. Elle a été initiée dans les affaires par sa mère depuis 1993. Rose et sa mère vendaient des sacs de manioc de Mbuji-Mayi à Mweneditu dans la province du Kasai Oriental en RDCongo. Après son mariage en 1995, Rose relança son affaire en 1997 avec un capital de $150. De 2003 à 2006, Elle diversifia son affaire en ajoutant la farine de manioc, des patates douces, des oignons ainsi que des tomates. Elle retourna à Kinshasa en 2006 et ouvrit une petite boutique jusqu’aujourd’hui. Son rêve est d’aller elle-même acheter la marchandise à l’étranger pour ouvrir une grande maison d’habillement mixte. Elle a actuellement un capital de $450, son affaire génère un bénéfice de $ 200 par mois. Elle a 33 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants élèves dont l’âge varie de 3 à 15 ans. Deux de ses enfants vivent avec leurs grands parents et trois habitent avec Rose et son mari. Rose et son groupe ont bien terminé leurs crédits recus au mois de novembre dernier.
texts.en:
Rose M. has a small general store. She also sells clothing for children, as well as items for women. She has been shown how to do business by her mother since 1993. Rose and her mother use to sell sacks of cassava from Mbuji-Mayi to Mweneditu in the province of Kasai Oriental in the Democratic Republic of Congo. After her marriage in 1995, Rose reinvigorated her business in 1997 with $150 in capital. From 2003 - 2006, she diversified by adding cassava flour, sweet potatoes, and onions, as well as tomatoes. She returned to Kinshasa in 2006 and opened a small shop, which she still has. Her dream is to go herself to procure merchandise abroad, so as to open a big house of mixed apparel. She currently has $450 in capital. Her business generates a profit of $200 per month. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of six children, students, whose ages vary from 3 to 14 years. Two of her children live with their grandparents, and three live with Rose and her husband. Rose and her group have settled the loans they obtained last November.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business by buying a sack of charcoal, a sack of rice, a 25-liter drum of palm oil, and 25 liters of refined vegetable oil

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Née le 23 Juillet 1974 à Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali), Madame Aminata K.est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Mancourani II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monitrice de jardin d’enfants  de  profession, elle  mène  une activité de petit commerce en plus de son métier afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle mène  cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers ( pagne wax, sacs à main, tissus brodés, etc.) il y a sept ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des voyageurs et des routiers) pour la qualité de ses produits. Vu l’emplacement de sa boutique située non loin de la gare routière de Sikasso, son activité marche bien.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de six  ans. Après 9 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Wayerma II), elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 4 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 complets de tissus brodés, 10 sacs à main, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place ensuite elle les revend dans sa boutique située au bord de route Route Nationale n° 7 non loin de la gare routière de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on July 23, 1974 in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali), Mrs. Aminata K.is married and the mother of 5 children and resides with her husband and their children in a big traditional family in Mancourani II, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso.

A licensed kindergarten teacher, she has a little business alongside her professional work so as to support herself. She has been working at this little commercial business buying and re-selling (high-quality "pagnes"--lengths of brightly colored African print cloth; handbags, embroidered fabrics, etc.) for 7 years. She is much in demand with her clientele (composed essentially of travelers and long-distance drivers) because of the quality of her products. In view of the placement of her little shop, not far from the bus station of Sikasso, her business is going well.

Wishing to better satisfy her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than 6 years ago. After 9 solidarity loans (group loans) with an association of women from her neighborhood (Association Benkadi de Wayerma II), she is on her second individual loan and all the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

She intends to use this loan to buy 4 lengths of high quality "pagne", 5 outfits of embroidered fabric, 10 handbags, etc. She does her buying in Bamako and where she lives, and then she sells out of her shop situated along National Road Number 7, not far from the bus station of Sikasso.

She expects that with this loan she will make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn, 25 years old, is a native Cagayana who lives in Barangay Minanga Sur of Iguig, Cagayan. She is already married and has two children. They are Fatima, three years old, and Ma. Milagros Ven who is two years old. Jenelyn was not able to finish college because of her family’s financial difficulties. Jenelyn has a small general store in their village that serves as the source of income for their family. Her husband assists her in her business and always gives a helping hand. They work hard and sacrifice a lot in order to become successful in their business. Jenelyn wants her store to grow. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of Php13,000.00. The loan proceeds will be used to buy additional items for her general store so she can acquire many more customers. Then she will be able to earn more profit,  which will be a big help in providing their basic needs in life. Also, with her earnings, she can allot some of her savings for her children's education. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her by lenders for it gives her hope that she can fulfill all her dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Карим Саидов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Карим занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 лет. До этого он 16 лет работал агрономом. Сын работает таксистом. Старший сын находится в России, на заработках. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков для откармливания и продажи. На полученный доход собиратся пристроить дом.
texts.en:
Karim S. lives in the Vahdat region. He is 53 years old, married and has four children. Karim is in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for two years. Before that he worked as an agronomist for sixteen years. His son works as a taxi driver. His oldest son is working in Russia right now. He is asking for a loan to buy calves for feeding and resale. He wants to use the profit to build an addition to the house.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en: Miriam P. is from the town of Gracia, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Miriam owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products in the local community like longganisa and chorizo (types of sausage). Miriam has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase inventory for her new store and as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and help provide the whole family’s basic needs. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new  store

loans.name: Ashurali

texts.en: M. Ashurali is married with three children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. Ashurali has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise five years ago with a starting capital of $200. Over time he expanded his business and now it has become domestic as his family helps him with the business. Today, Ashurali needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 2,300 Somoni. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en: Ghaleb is 44 years old and married with three sons. Ghaleb has been running a store where he sells different kinds of goods such as perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, and other items.  He is an expert vendor and often recommends specific products to his many customers.  Ghaleb requests a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase merchandise and build his new inventory.  He appreciates your help.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and build his new inventory

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais was born in 1968. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan and settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Kayidish, specifically built for IDPs. He is married, has four children.

Eight years ago Mais started his dairy business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy two cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows to improve his dairy business

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.en:
A. Ravshanjon, age 24, is a very diligent and hardworking young man. In addition to his wife, he is also supporting his parents. He provides taxi services with his own car. For the last three years, this business has been the main source of income allowing Ravshanjon to improve the living conditions of his large family. As with any business, Ravshanjon's business also requires some investment from time to time. At present, his car needs some fixing. For this reason, Ravshanjon requests $900 US to purchase spare parts for his car. Ravshanjon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all those supporting him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To repair a taxi

loans.name: Selene De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Selene S. C. es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de dos años de edad. La señora Selene tiene actualmente 4 años de dedicarse a la comercialización de muebles de mimbre y de madera, estos generalmente los compra a un señor que los elabora, para luego comercializarlo a las personas conocidas. Cabe señalarse, que la señora también obtiene ingresos adicionales para la manutención de su hijo y de ella de un trabajo que posee en el Hospital. Ella se introdujo en este negocio por su hermana, ya que anteriormente la misma se dedicaba a esta actividad. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de 2 juegos de sillas  para comercializarlas. Su sueño es brindar la educación necesaria a su hijo a través del comercio de sus mercancías. Además desea reinvertir cada día más en el negocio para que este crezca y que pueda ser autosuficiente para mantenerla a ella y a su hijo.
texts.en:
Selene S. C. is a single mother with a two year old child. Selene has been selling wicker furniture for four years. She usually buys from a man who makes the furniture. She later sells it to people she knows. She also receives additional income for child maintenance and from a job she has in the hospital. Her sister used to be in this business, and she introduced Selene to the business. Her loan will be used to buy two sets of chairs to sell. Her dream is to give her son the necessary education by selling her merchandise. Also, she wishes to reinvest more every day in the business. She wants to do this so it will grow and so that she will be self sufficient in order to support herself and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: M. Sarah is a 38 year old, friendly and hard working lady. She is a business woman with a charcoal selling business in Kikooza that she has owned for 15 years. She is a caring person who minds about her customers’ needs and wants and this has kept her in business with so many loyal customers. She is able to make some profits that help her look after her family including paying their school fees. Sarah is a widow with 4 children with the eldest being 23 years and in Secondary school. She needs a loan to help buy more bags of charcoal from the villages so as to increase her sock hence more sales.

loans.use: Buying more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a realizar las diversas tareas del campo, tanto en la siembra como en la ganadería, D. ese modo ha visto a lo largo D. los años recompensas y algunos fracasos, pero aun así desD. seguir siendo una esforzada agricultora. Por tal motivo, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para llevar a sus vacas al campo para su alimentación y posteriormente trabaja en sus chacras, pero cuando es la época D. siembra o D. cosecha todos los integrantes D. su familia participan unánimes para obtener buenos resultados. Los productos que Senobia cultiva principalmente son la papa, el maíz y el trigo, que son los productos más demandados en su región.
Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, ella tiene grandes deseos D. continuar con su banco comunal, por lo que renueva su compromiso D. seguir siendo puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono y en el alquiler D. un tractor para remover su terreno y prepararlo para la siembra.
texts.en:
Senobia is 60 years old, and lives with her husband and their two children in their own home. Since her childhood, she has worked in diverse activities in the land, both in growing crops and raising livestock. In this way she has seen, throughout the years, both rewards and failures, but in spite of this she puts great effort into being a farmer. For this reason, she wakes up very early every day to take her cows to the fields to feed and later works on her gardens. But when it is time to sow or harvest, every member of her family participates unanimously to obtain good results. The products that Senobia grows are mainly potato, corn and wheat, which are the products in greatest demand in her region. This is her 15th loan with MFP. She has great desire to continue with her communal bank, so she renews her commitment to continue being punctual in her payments. The money she now requests will be invested in buying sacks of fertilizer and in renting a tractor to turn over her land and prepare it for sowing time.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn M. is from the village of Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Rocelyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Rocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling barbecued meats in the local community. Rocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rocelyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en:
Enyonam is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Enyonam is a baker and bakes bread for sale. She sells in the local market and also supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Enyonam has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other baking ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia DOMINGA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ella vive en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba.  
  
La socia tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija mujer que estudia la carrera profesional de Turismo. la socia es docente del nivel primario en el colegio “Sillabamba” del distrito de San Salvador.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la enseñanza en las mañanas y por las noches ella trabaja en su puesto de venta de comida al paso, vende salchipapas (comida Peruana con ingredientes: papas y salchichas) y pollipapas (comida Peruana con ingredientes como: papas, salchichas y pollo). Ya tiene varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone a su trabajo.      

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comida al paso. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Domingo belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She lives in the Calca district in the Urubamba province. She is a 50 year old single mother. She has a daughter who is studying for a professional career in tourism. She is a primary school teacher in the Sillabamba School in the San Salvador district. She alternates her activities between the home, teaching in the mornings, and in the evenings selling fast food from her stand. She sells “salchipapas” (Peruvian food with potatoes and sausages) and “pollipapas” (Peruvian food with ingredients like potatoes, sausages, and chicken). She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of selling fast food. She is grateful to the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies like potatoes, sausages, and chicken to make her fast food

loans.name: Elizabaeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ELIZABAETH es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hija. Su hija se llama Isis, tiene catorce años, estudia en el colegio “MADI” y esta en el quinto grado de secundaria. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
  
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio  de producción y venta de velas a las tiendas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a su hija dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio lo empezó su padre y ahora ella es quien administra el negocio. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción de velas como parafina y pabilo. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabaeth is a humble mother. She is 44 years old and acts as both mother and father for her daughter, Isis. Isis is 14 years old and studies at the “Madi” school and is in the fifth grade of secondary school. They live in the city of Cusco.

Elizabaeth is a member of the “Unidos Para El Triunfo” communal bank. She has a small business producing and selling candles to the stores. She has had this business several years and it has been successful due to the determination she puts into her work. Her father started the business, but now she is in charge.

Elizabeth is a hardworking, enterprising, and responsible mother who is trying to help her daughter get ahead, giving her a good education. She needs this loan to buy materials for the production of candles, such as paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for candle production, such as paraffin and wicks.

loans.name: Alfonso Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Alfonso Alberto L., tiene la edad de 48 años. El Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Cuatros hijos a su cargo, todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlines, ladrillos, cemento, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del techo y el piso de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor Alfonso Alberto L. is 48 years old. He works in sanitation in the Oriental Market of Managua. He is married and has four children in school. During the last five years, thanks to loans granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested 6 loans in the improvement of his home. He is a valued customer. This loan will be invested in construction materials such as zinc, metal structural supports, bricks, cement, etc. He will use these materials to replace the roof and floor of his home, with the objectives of improved security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Amen

texts.en:
Amen C. is from the city of Turayong, Cauayan, Isabela. She is 50 years old, married, and has six adult children. To make a living, Amen owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Amen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 weekly.

In 2007, Amen joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Amen is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn S. is a 24-year-old and a mother who cares for her three children. She is married to Mario, who is a laborer. All of their three children are of minor age. To assist her husband to support the family, Jelyn started a business buying and selling frozen foods.

She has applied for a first loan to buy an assortment of frozen products for her business. She has joined ASHI to secure capital for frozen foods and expand her business.

As a new ASHI member, she hopes to be able to send her children to school until they finish college. She also dreams of building a durable house of their own. With the chance given to her family by ASHI, KIVA's partner, the couple believes that they are getting closer to achieving their family dreams.

loans.use: purchase of frozen food products to expand her business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila L. is from the village of Dimako Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Lucila is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lucila raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lucila has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lucila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Cien Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Cien Flores lo conforman tre mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de seguir adelante. Una  de ellas es la joven Ana Lorena López Hernández quien desde la edad  de 16 años empezó hacer tortillas como un medio de sus sistencia y en estos 8 años a logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella invertira el credito en la compra de materia prima para este producto tan demandado por la población.
 
Sus compañeras son Ayde García quien desde hace 10 años tiene una comideria y refresqueria y Marisol del Rosario García de 36 años de edad comercializa ropa.
texts.en:
The group "Las Cien Flores" ("The Hundred Flowers") is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women with a strong desire to get ahead. One of them is the young Ana Lorena López Hernández, who has made tortillas for a living since the age of 16. During these 8 years, she has succeeded in raising her family's standard of living. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials for her product, which is in great demand among the population. Her fellow members are Ayde García, who has operated a business selling food and soft drinks for 10 years, and Marisol del Rosario García, age 36, who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and firewood

loans.name: Rosa Veneranda

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Veneranda R., Habita en la Colonia Roberto González, es madre soltera de dos hijos ambos en edad escolar, La señora Rosa Veneranda tiene un tramo en el Bisne de chinelas, Ropa, Artículos escolares, en fin un poco de cada cosa para tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La señora Rosa Veneranda tiene a su hija mayor en la Universidad y para que su hija se ayude con ese gasto le puso en su casa de habitación una pequeña pulpería, entonces ella atiende los días de semana la venta y los sábados viaja a león a la universidad y su mama atiende el tramo todos los días de la semana.

 La señora Rosa Veneranda solicito el crédito para incrementar su inventario de sandalias y chinelas ya que estamos en temporada de playa y es lo que más se le mueve.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Colonia Roberto González and is the single mother of two school-aged children. She has a cart where she sells slippers, clothing, school items…a number of items in order to offer a variety to her customers. Rosa's oldest daughter attends university, so she set up a small store in her home in order to help her daughter with school expenses. [Her daughter] runs the store during the week. She travels to university in León on Saturdays. Her mother manages the cart every day. Rosa requested this loan in order to increase her inventory of sandals and slippers. Now that the beach season is here, these are the items she sells the most of.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Née en 1973, H. Pascaline est mariée à KAKPO Sylvain, un couturier. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a environs trois ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Pascaline apporte une aide financière à son mari et partage avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Pascaline mène comme activité la vente de volaille à Allada. De façon secondaire, Pascaline vend des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières et bols en séries) à Allada. Pascaline s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et aussi à Allada. Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits de ALIDé. Pascaline a bien remboursés lesdits crédits. En vue de rehausser son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Pascaline sollicite un troisième crédit ; ce qui lui permettra d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Pascaline H. is married to Sylvain KAKPO, a couturier. The couple has four children who are all at school. Around three years ago the family settled in the Dodomey district of Allada, in the "département" (administrative district) of Atlantique. Pascaline helps out her husband financially and they share responsibility for the family expenses. In order to do this, Pascaline has an activity selling poultry at Allada. As a secondary activity she sells kitchenware (ice-boxes and sets of bowls) in Allada. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, and also in Allada. Pascaline has been carrying out this business for around ten years and has already had two loans from ALIDé. She repaid both these loans without incident. In order to increase her business and her turnover she is applying for a third loan which will allow her to enhance her income.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Bisa Nyame Group

texts.en:
Agatha is forty-one years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children, some of whom are currently in school while others work. The children are aged between three and twenty-four. Agatha lives with her children and husband, a cocoa farmer, in a rented apartment in their community. 

Agatha is a hard-working woman who uses her business proceeds to help her husband financially to cater for the family. She trades in a food item – meat. She supplies meat to food vendors in her community. Agatha has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure her inventory in bulk. She desires to own a house to accommodate the family.

Agatha is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Bisa Nyame’, meaning, 'ask God'. It is a four-member group and it is made up of petty traders and palm oil producers. The group leader says the members are all truthful.

loans.use: buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La Sra. Doris llego a las instalaciones de nuestra institucion por recomendacion de uno de nuestos clientes que ya habian sido beneficiado con en credito dentro de la institucion, la Sra. Doris vive en la zona de la Pampa de la Isla perteneciente a la cuidad de Santa Cruz Bolivia, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con sus tres hijos,  hace aproximadamente 1 año atras se habian separado con su esposo cuenta que fue dificil para ella la separacion pero supo reponerse por el bienestar de sus hijos, ahora ya se encuentra mejor, cuenta con negocio propio en su mismo domicilio esta es una tienda de barrio el la cual maneja desde hace 1 año, el monto del credito es para la inversion en el mismo negocio ya que comprará mercaderia, ya que por el momento no tiene competencia por donde vive ya que es la unica tienda de barrio, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Doris was introduced to our institution by some of our customers who have benefited from a loan from our institution. Doris lives in the Pampa de la Isla area, an area that forms part of the town of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She owns the house she lives in with her three children; she separated from her husband about 1 year ago: it has been difficult for her after they parted, but she managed to recover for the wellbeing of her children. Now she feels better and she runs her own business, a corner shop located in her house that she has been managing for 1 year. The amount she is requesting will be used to invest in her business by buying more products. There is not much competition in the area where she lives, as hers is the only corner shop there. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to sell.

loans.name: Kimeenu Ole

texts.en:
Kimeenu Ole N. is 33 years old. He is married to Noolamala N. and he is the father of six school-going children. 

Kimeenu is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last eight years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the money on beans and maize farming. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his farm production. 

His future dream is that he will be able to practice large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Beans and maize farming

loans.name: Faithful People Group

texts.en:
Miatta G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faithful People.  She is 44 years old, married and has six children who range from 10 to 23 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.  She cares for two siblings.  All of her children attend school.

For four years, she has been selling fish at Gbenbga Town Market outside Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 42,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more fish.
 
Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es casado y vive con sus dos hijos y su señora, se dedica a la elaboración de pan. 
Hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, el cual lo comercializa de forma ambulante en una bicicleta de carga, sus clientes  son vecinos y amigos, personas que encuentra durante sus recorridos, con este negocio el solventa las necesidades básicas de su familia,
Juan actualmente compra el pan ya elaborado por terceras personas, pero el necesita un préstamo para compra de un horno industrial para que el pueda elaborar sus propios productos ( pan dulce) y comercializarlo, es espera que con esto pueda obtener más ganancias y mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son tener su negocio establecido en su casa de habitación, hacer pan de buena calidad para sus clientes, para obtener ingresos  para ayudar a su familia y mantener su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 38, lives in San Miguel. He is married, and he lives with his wife and their two children. He devotes himself to making bread. For five years he has been selling sweet breads. He sells as a street vendor with a bicycle, which carries the bread. His customers are neighbors, friends, and the people he meets on his trips. With this business he pays for his family’s basic necessities. Juan currently buys the bread already made by third parties. But, he needs a loan to buy an industrial oven in order to be able to make his own products (sweet bread) and sell them. He hopes that with this he will be able to get greater earnings and improve his family’s quality of life. His aspirations are to have an established business in his house, and to make good quality bread for his customers. He will do this in order to get income to help his family and to maintain his job.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an industrial oven to make bread

loans.name: Guasaule Group

texts.es:
el grupo Guasaule lo integran 3 mujeres que son muy amigas y que se conocen desde hace varios años. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan en su diario vivir:
doña Reyna Cristina M. se dedica a la compra y venta de granos basicos, los vende en grande cantidades a personas que le encargan dicho producto, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas granos basicos al por mayor y asi tener mejores ganancias.
doña Paca Francisca P. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general, actividad que a venido desempeñando desde hace varios años, en el lugar donde esta ubicado su negocio es muy concurrido y tiene bastante demanda. El credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia.
doña Julia Amalia F. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general, en el lugar donde esta su negocio
hay mucho paso de personas, es un lugar fronterizo y pasan muchos turistas.
el credito lo necesita para aumentar su inventario y tener mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The Guasaule Group is made up of 3 women who are friends and who have known one another for some years. Here are their various daily activities: Reyna Cristina M. buys and sells basic grains, selling in large quantities to those who order. She will use the loan to buy more basic grains wholesale, and thus have higher profits. Paca Francisca P. sells foodstuffs in general, and this has been her business for several years. Her operation is very busy and demand is strong. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise. Julia Amalia F. sells foodstuffs in general. Her business is located where there is heavy traffic. It’s on the border and many tourists pass through. She needs the loan to increase her inventory and have a more varied product line.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, corn, rice, coffee, bread, soft drinks, soups, pastas, sauces

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en: T. Azamjon is a 27-year-old farmer. He is married and has a 2-year-old son. His wife is a housewife and this makes him the sole breadwinner. He has been farming for the last eight years on his piece of land, growing tomato, cucumber, potato and melon. Azamjon would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield. He requests a 5500 somoni loan to be used for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing his crop. Azamjon is very responsible and is promising to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos C. Sr. is from the village of Manaoag. He is 44 years old. Marcos is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcos owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marcos has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marcos joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcos has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Marcos is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcos from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Family Tree Group

texts.en: George K., with the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Family Tree. George is 31 years old, single, and has two children aged 12 and 15. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of support. For 5 years, he has operated a motorbike transportation business on Water Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 63,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy spare parts and petroleum. He describes himself as an earnest man whose goal is to improve his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and petroleum

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma B. main source of income comes from making and selling specialty food products like honey in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. Alma has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
