She sells candies and sweets in the local market . Her sons help her with the business. She works very hard to give her dearest sons a good education and to make them happy. Mehrubon is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 4 months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her.

loans.use: To purchase candies to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia started her business to help with her family's household costs. Her husband's salary as a laborer in the fields was not enough to cover their expenses nor support their six children. She began her business by selling a small piece of land she'd inheritied and investing the money in a small clothing stand. Little by little she has grown the business and helped improve the quality of life for her family.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales.

Leticia inició el negocio para complementar el gasto familiar ya que con el sueldo de su esposo quien se dedica a labores del campo no les alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar ademas de la manutencion de su 6 hijos. Ella comenzó su negocio con el dinero de un terreno que le heredaron y que vendio, puso un pequeño puesto de ropa , mismo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco y es lo que le ha permitido darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi lograr impulsar sus ventas .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO HELP SUPPORT HER FAMILY

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. José is 60 years old. He is the father of 3 children that have their own families and makes enough to support Mrs. Estela, he wife. José is the owner of a motorcar and he works providing transport to passenger as he has for quite some time, and he works hard to give his wife the things she needs to live securely and happily. Previously José raised chickens but he gave up that work due to health reasons, and now he would like to sell groceries and staple products. José is a dedicated and enterprising father and he would like to continue his family's financial growth but he needs a loan to complete his objectives such as fixing his motorcar. With your help, Mr. José will realize his goals in no time at all.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

El señor José tiene 60 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, los mismos que ya tienen su propia familia, su esposa la señora Estela lo apoya bastante. José es propietario de un motocarro y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde ya tiempo atrás, él trabaja duro por brindarle a su esposa lo necesario y ambos vivan felices y tranquilos.Anteriormente José se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, pero lo dejó por motivos de salud, y ahora quiere vender abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. José es un padre emprendedor y decidido que quiere seguir creciendo, sin embargo, requiere de un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo, como también arreglar su motocarro. Con tu ayuda el señor José logrará su meta en el tiempo menos esperado.

loans.use: To repair his motorcar and to start a small store

loans.name: Firudun

texts.en: 5 years ago, Firudun started this business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in Fuzuli region. He was born in 1968. He is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the foodstuffs to expand his wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: This is the fifth time of Mrs. Mork C. L. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She lives in Trapaing Pouv Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she sells rice and farms. Her husband, Mr. Muth Art is a fisherman and pig breeder. His fishing business is facing a small problem, because his boat is too old. So, Mrs. Mork C. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband's business. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Mork C. L. is 34 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Mrs. Mork C. L. had previously obtained a loan to buy a pump for watering her plantation, which she fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Marisa Judith

texts.es: Marisa  Judith C. A. es una mujer que tiene un hijo por el cual la motiva tener deseo de superarse ella se dedica a poner uñas de acrílico de todas formas y colores. También es estilista pero aun no se dedica a esto por que le falta utensilios de trabajo, mobiliario y  local donde esta hubicado su negocio es pequeño. Con el préstamo que se le otorgué piensa comprar todo lo que necesita para su nuevo local, como pueden observar en la fotografía es el local que piensa rentar para su estética. La cantidad de dinero que necesita es la cantidad de $775 dólares. Sus ingreso los percibe por medio del negocio de poner uñas pero ya teniendo su nueva estética obtendría mas dinero y su esposo trabaja en el municipio
texts.en:
Maris Judith C. A. is a women who has one son which is her motivation to improve her life and what led her to dedicate herself to providing acrylic nails in all forms and colors. She is also a stylist but as she doesn't have the work tools, furnishing and other things for this, as the location where she hold her business is very small. So she is not as dedicated to it. With this loan she is hoping to purchase all the necessary tools for a new location, as you can see in the photograph, taken at the location which we is hoping to rent for her beauty salon. She is requesting $ 775 dollars. She is able to pay half of her spendings from selling/placing nails but when she has her new beauty salon set up seh will profit from much more money. Her husband works for the city, in the municaplity.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and furnishings for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema M., 38 years old, is from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, 11 and 15 years old.  Since 2004, Rehema has been running a grocery store, where she sells general items, including onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. Rehema's store is popular among the local people, especially at times when they need one or two missing ingredients for cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market.

Rehema works 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by her husband. She currently needs a loan of TZH 770,000 in order to purchase additional inventory for her store, such as juice and soda. Rehema thanks everyone for supporting her.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory in bulk for a grocery store

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. is a villager in Sromouch Nor village in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  

She is 47 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a taxi driver, while the youngest one is attending the local school.  Although she and her children have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well.  So, Mrs. Touch P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after she sells her cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Da

texts.en:
Mrs. Da U. lives in Trapaing Saum Village in Takeo Province.  She is 48 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is an air-conditioner repairer, another attends the local school, and the remaining children stay at home and help on the farm and do housework.  

Mrs. Da U. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Long Nin, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support the family. Even thought they work hard, they still have trouble providing a good standard of living for their family. Therefore, Mrs. Da U. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to breed.

She is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay K. works making and selling rice noodles in a local market in Takeo province, Cambodia. She earns $2.50 every day. She is 56 years old and has five children with her husband (pictured here), who earns $3 a day. This couple also receives support from two of their children, who work making incense and are employed in a garment factory.

Lay K. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorbike and trailer. The trailer will transport goods and people in the village.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike and trailer to operate a taxi

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi S. S.  is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur businessman. He runs a café and bar at Mbagala Ward in Dar ers Salaam. He sells a variety of soft drinks and hot (alcoholic) drinks and his café sells varieties of food, including pork, goat, chicken and cow meat. His wife is a business manager. He has been running this business for the past six years. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 to expand his business

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Christina's Group

texts.en:
Christina is a milk and eggs seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya.. She belongs to Amani group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 600. Every day she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more milk and eggs for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Christina is married, and has seven children: ages 37, 27, 28, 22, 18, 17 and 15. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Upendo, who has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more milk and eggs for re-sale

loans.name: Virginia Judith

texts.es:
La señora Virginia A. es una dama que habita en la ciudad de León donde labora a diario con el propósito de brindarle las mejores condiciones a sus hijos para que se desarrollen.

Hoy en día ella ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda por el motive de que ha estado deteriorada y require brindarle las mejores condiciones a sus hijos. Por este motivo al haber iniciado la obra de construcción detuvo la construcción para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloque sólido, arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros para dar lugar a la construcción y así brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia A. lives in the city of León where she works daily with the goal of providing her children with the best conditions possible for their development. Recently, she has begun rebuilding her home, as it had deteriorated and she needs to provide the best conditions for her children. For this reason, having already begun the construction, she stopped to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as concrete blocks, sand, cement, iron, etc. in order to proceed with the construction and be able to provide the best possible living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two sons and lives with her husband in a small apartment. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol City. She has 10,000 UAH invested in inventory; her profit is 3,000 UAH per month.

Olga has been in this business for more than 10 years. She knows her kind of goods well enough to purchase the right inventory. Along with that, Olga offers excellent client service and affordable prices. She wants to develop her business and receive additional profit to improve her living conditions.

Olga would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She wants to offer her clients the best choice of clothing and make better sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of women's clothing

loans.name: Origama Kadija Musa Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kadija M. is aged 32 years, married with 8 kids, all schooling. For over 4 years she has been selling fish. She is using the loan to purchase fish in big volume for selling. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish in big volume for selling

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is a 55-year-old father of two children. He lives and works in Nakuru where he has had a private health practice since 1989. He provides reproductive health, curative services, family planning, PAK and minor surgeries. He is trained as a nurse, in family planning, and general reproductive health.

John sees between 140 and 150 clients a month. His clients range from those in the slum to more middle class people. He says it's important to balance his clientele as oftentimes the clients from the slum cannot pay their bills. He says he sometimes feels guilty but he cannot serve everyone all the time for free.

He is asking for a loan so that he can repair his car that he uses to visit distant patients. The rest he will use for improvements to the clinic like painting, buying drugs, and repairing the floor. He said the most important aspect is the car, as many of his clients don’t have the means to come to him.

Note: Mr. M.'s interview was taped prior to an informational meeting where he and other borrowers (all primary care providers) were informed that the maximum amount they could receive for their first loan was $1200 USD . Mr. Yegon agreed that he would take $1200 USD but the interviewer did not have time to re-tape the interview.

loans.use: automobile repair, medicines

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Ruth Díaz P. tiene 51 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Incompleta Técnica en Farmacia, tiene  2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Gladys se dedica a la Venta de Medicina, coloca inyecciones y hace curaciones de heridas, este negocio se inicio hace 11 años, cuando le dieron un pequeño Botiquín que ella fue implementándolo poco a poco, su negocio es dentro de su casa y sale a hacer curaciones e inyecciones a domicilio.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como agujas, alcohol, medicina.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como agujas, alcohol, medicina para implementar su botiquín.
Gladys tiene como sueño tener su Botica comunal para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Gladys Ruth D. P. is 51 year old, and lives in the neighborhood of Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the district of Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She started, but did not finish, a graduate program in Pharmacy, and has 2 children that depend on her economically. Ever since she was given a small medicine chest 11 years ago, Gladys has worked selling medicines, administering injections, and dressing wounds. She runs this business out of her home, but also offers house-calls for injections and wound care. She received her first loan of 300 soles from the community bank Lideresas en Accion II, and invested that money in the purchase of products such as needles, alcohol and medicines. She will invest this loan of 800 soles in the same products in order to restock her medicine chest. Gladys' dream is to start a neighborhood pharmacy in order to grow as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of needles, alcohol, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Good Hope Masika Josephine Group

texts.en:
M. Josephine is married with six children, all going to school. And she also looks after five dependants who are also going to school.

She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as soap, sugar, salt, biscuits, sweets, etc. to meet her customers' demands and to expand her business. M. Josephine is a hardworking business woman whose dream remains expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, sugar, salt, biscuits, sweets, etc and expand her business.

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en: Adebola sells frozen foods and other foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past seven years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years. She is 37 years old and married with three children. Adebola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide nasceu na capital maputo, tem 48 anos de idade e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 16 aos 35 anos de idade. Somente as três mais novas e que vão à escola. vive somente com os filhos e sem ninguém mais por sua responsabilidade.

Sai de maputo quando seu pai perde a vida e esta porque era muito nova e sua mãe não tinha condições de lhe cuidar, é levada pelas irmãs missionárias de Maria para namaacha onde cuidaram dela dando lhe assistência. Durante a sua estadia ela aprende a fazer artesanato e crochê e anos depois juntam se com seu marido e assim teve que sair da casa das irmãs e passa a viver com seu esposo. Começa a programar os trabalhos que aprendeu, fazendo crochê e vendendo nas cooperativas. Mas, como seu trabalho era muito elogiado ela consegue fazer encomendas a grosso para uma empresa na cidade capital e com os lucros consegue comprar um terreno. Anos depois ela separa se do seu marido deixando a com 5 filhos por criar a vida fica muito difícil, mas com ajuda das irmãs missionárias ela consegue supurar as dificuldades, pois estas dão lhe um fundo e ela opta em construir quartos de aluguer, hoje é proprietária de 5 dependências das quais 2 estão em funcionamento cobrando 1.500.00MT de aluguer por mês. Para alem das dependências é proprietária de 2 bancas onde vende sacos de batata e cebola a grosso adquiridos na vizinha swazilandia a 160x20 e a 170x20 cada e revendidos em namaacha a 200x20 e a 200x20..
Consegue poupar o seu dinheiro no xitique (esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa) de 1.000.00MT que faz de 15 em 15 dias num grupo de 12 pessoas.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este e o primeiro empréstimo de Adelaide na hluvuku e com kiva. Estes 20.000.00MT serão usados para comprar material de construção para dar continuidades das suas dependências, pois não vê a hora de terminar e começar a praticar outros negócios, pois.
Esta cheia de projetos. Futuramente pretende pedir um ovo empréstimo e torna se uma grande comerciante.
texts.en:
Adelaide was born in the capital city of Maputo. She is 48 years old and has 5 children between the ages of 16-35. The youngest three still attend school and she lives only with her children—she doesn’t have any other family members in her care. She left Maputo after her father died. She was very young and her mother did not have the resources to take care of her, so she was taken to Namaacha and cared for by the missionary nuns. During her time with the nuns she learned to make handicrafts and crochet. Years later, she met her husband and left her home with the nuns. She began making crochet projects and selling them to co-ops. Her work was often praised so she was able to start making large orders for a company in the capital city. With the income from that project she bought some land. Later, she separated from her husband and was left with 5 children to care for. Her life was very difficult, but with the help of the missionaries she was able to overcome those difficulties. They gave a base and she was able to build some rooms to rent out. Today she is the owner of 5 small apartments, 2 of which are functioning and provide her with 1.500.00MT per month in rent money. She is also the owner of two market stalls where she sells large orders of potatoes and onions which she gets from neighboring Swaziland for the price of 160x20 and 170x20, then resells in Namaacha for the price of 200x20 and 200x20. She saves her money in a xitique (a traditional, rotating way of saving money). She pays 1.000.00 MT every 15 days among 12 people and each person in the rotation collects the whole account once. She has never worked with another lending company and this is her first loan with Hluyuku and with Kiva. The 20.000.00MT will be used to buy construction material for her apartments. She is very anxious to finish them so she can begin other jobs. She is full of projects! In the future she plans on taking out another loan and becoming a great saleswoman.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction material

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед Ашуров проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Чамшед более 4 лет занимается производством. Он производит национальные сундуки(шкатулки). Он имеет постоянных покупателей, которые купив товар продают его на рынке подороже. Киент просит кредит для закупа сырья, чтобы изготовить новые виды.
texts.en:
Jamshed A. lives in the Gissar region. He is 23 years old. He is married and has one child. Jamshed has been in manufacturing for more than four years. He makes traditional chest boxes. He has regular customers who sell his goods for more on the market. The client is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make more varieties.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, commonly known by her nickname “Letty,” is 51 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is Patricio T. and they live in a good relationship with their four children in the rural community of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Some of her children are currently studying in high school, while her eldest child works as a saleslady in their public market to help them support the family's important needs.

Their main source of income is derived from farming, practised by her husband, while Leticia manages a sari-sari store to earn additional revenue for the family. In order to achieve a higher income, she is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to purchase stocks of soft drinks and establish a small eatery that will be part of her business expansion.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: N. Irene is a hardworking salon business lady of twenty-eight years old, single lady with two children. She is a professional in dressing hair. She has been doing her business for three years. She is using the loan to buy some new machines and chemicals for the salon that of course for the excellent work to attract more and more customers. She wishes to construct the rental houses for more income generating

loans.use: To buy some new machines and chemicals for the salon

loans.name: Senen

texts.en:
Senen M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 61 years old. Senen is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Senen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Senen has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Senen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Senen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Senen is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Senen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Auxiliadora Del Carmen

texts.es: Auxiliadora está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una cocina), trabaja como docente de primaria en la escuela Paulino Halsall, vive en la colonia Yolaina  a 15 kilometros de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, tiene 2 hijos , la niña mayor de 6 añitos estudia 2do año de educación primaria, la otra hija de Educación primaria y el niño menor de 3 añitos, su esposo trabaja como docente en la misma escuela que ella trabaja, ambos comparte los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos, su sueño es seguir  estudiando, tener salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones  y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is asking to refinance her 2nd loan to invest in improvements for her home (construction on a new kitchen). She works as a primary school teacher at the Paulino Halsall School. She lives in the Yolaina colony, 15 kilometers from New Guinea where the population grows more every day. She has two daughters and two sons: An older son, an older daughter of 6 who is in her 2nd year of primary education, another daughter who in her first year of primary school, and a younger son who is 3. Her husband works as a teacher at the same school where she works. The both share in the household expenses and acquired commitments. Her dream is to continue studying, to have health and in the future to have a nice home with all the amenities, and to have job stability so that she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home construction

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine N. est une femme de 44 ans elle est veuve et vit avec ses 8 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "ARTILLERIE" depuis 2 ans. Son crédit lui permet mener de petites activité commerciales, elle vend des céréales, des tissus et fait de l'embouche ovine. c'est avec les bénéfices générés par ses activités qu'elle entretien ses enfants et subvient à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Yacine N. is a 44-year-old woman. She is a widow and lives with her eight children whom she supports. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "ARTILLERIE" for two years. Her loan allows her to run small commercial businesses. Yacine sells grains and cloth, and she fattens sheep. With the profits earned from her businesses, she takes care of her children and supports herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat A. is 31 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman who started her business in 2002 and has become very experienced and skilled in raising calves. She has applied for a loan of 1606 AZN to expand her flock. She believes this will help her generate greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her three children.

In the future, Matanat plans to buy additional calves to increase her income further. We hope that you will play an important role in her family life because she deeply appreciates the trust and support lenders give her.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Dula

texts.es:
Dula tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, cría ovejas y toros para venderlos en la feria ganadera de su localidad. También cultiva papa, habas y olluco, productos que lleva a vender a la ciudad más cercana. Todo este trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, pues su esposo trabaja en otro lugar. De esta manera, Dula genera los recursos para solventar las necesidades diarias de su hogar. Por lo que viene planeando la posibilidad de adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para incrementar su producción agrícola.

Es la primera vez que Dula tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, siendo ésta una experiencia nueva, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de una vaquillona.
texts.en:
Dula, 34, lives with her husband and three children. For the past 15 years she has been a farmer. She raises sheep and bulls to sell them in the local livestock fair. She also grows potato, flat bean, olluco (a tuber) which she sells in the nearest city. Her children help her with all this work because her husband works elsewhere. This allows Dula to earn enough to meet daily household expenses. She is planning to acquire additional farmland in order to increase her farm production. This is Dula's first loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a member of a communal bank as this is a new experience for her; she pledges to make her repayments on time. The funds needed will be used to buy a heifer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa J., who trades in cutlery and enamel dishes, owns a shop in the central business area.  She is married to a businessman and has three children, all in primary school.  Hawa is requesting a loan to buy additional cutlery and enamel dishes from Freetown and Conakry to increase her stock, sales and profit, and hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to expand her business and educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 66 years old and married, and she has two children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. 

Patience sells baby things, such as clothes, flasks, bathing bowls, etc. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She sells her goods in the market. 

Patience is hoping for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She has been in this business for a long time.She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Хусайнов Сафарали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Хусайнов Сафарали имеет высшее образование по специальности "Налоговик". Растениеводством занимается более 15 лет. Хусайнов Сафарали сажает деревья. Кредит берет для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Sarafali H. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. Sarafali has a higher education as a tax collector. He has been involved in horticulture for over 15 years. Sarafali plants trees. He is requesting this loan for the new crop planting.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New crop planting

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia B. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Ofelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. Ofelia owns & operates a food production & sales business. She sells speciality food products like viands and rice. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ofelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first one taken out by Ofelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her food business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita F. is a 31-year-old, married woman with the determination and faith to get out from poverty. She is a mother to two young children. Her husband, Danilo, is a vendor. She explains that her husband's salary alone is insufficient to cover their family's daily living needs.

As a mother with big dreams, she joined Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2004. ASHI is a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started selling ready-to-wear-clothes, which really helped to improve her family's standard of living. She is now seeking her fourth loan from ASHI, this time in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325), to purchase additional inventory for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for blouses, shirts, sandals, jeans, short pants, and other supplies. She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA's field partners, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her two children in school. One of her dreams is to someday own their own house.

About ASHI: ASHI has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank's approach of providing credit to the poor people of the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the pioneers of microfinance in the country.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., blouses, shirts, sandals, jeans, and short pants)

loans.name: Mabel's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1985 by the Catholic mission to educate the children of the Kolo Kolo community, on the outskirts of Makeni. Currently, the school is staffed with 12 teachers and has 550 pupils.

This is the second loan these teachers are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mabel C. who is pictured second from right is the leader of this group of teachers. The 43-year-old was born in Gbonkolenken village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have 5 children – four of them are attending secondary school and one is in a tertiary institution.  Mabel, who has been a teacher for 24 years, is requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 in order to buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc.

loans.name: Josefa Benita

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Benita M. S., es trabajadora  de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, habita en el Barrio de San Agustín no tiene hijos a cargo.
	
La señora Josefa Benita M. S. solicito el crédito para realizar mejoras en su casa, ya que desea asegurarla por que permanece la mayor parte del tiempo sola y teme se le metan a robar sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Señora Josefa Benita M. S. works for the mayor's office of Chinandega as a cleaner. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood and has no children. Señora Josefa is requesting a loan for improvements to her house to make it more secure, since she is alone most of the time and fears having her possessions stolen.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Yesu Nti Group

texts.en:
Mercy is forty-one years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to three children who are between the ages of six and seventeen. Mercy lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. Her husband is a trader. He trades in general goods in a shop in the community. 

Mercy is a hard-working and a trustworthy woman. She is a seamstress by profession. She has been sewing for fifteen years and has trained a number of apprentices who are also currently manning their own shops. Mercy buys her raw materials such as textiles and other sewing accessories, including needles, linings, thread, etc. from nearby towns. She hopes to put up her own building structure to house her family.

Mercy is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesu Nti’, which literally means ‘because of Jesus’. The group is made up of five members. Some are traders and others are into hairdressing. They request the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy textiles and sewing accessories

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna, 28, is a resident of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is a rice and pig farmer, managing a rice field and a piggery. She has two children to support; the eldest is 9 years old. She lacks capital, that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., and requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will help her a lot by providing fertilizers for her rice field and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana del Carmen S. D. P. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por: su esposo el cual trabaja como agente metropolitano D. seguridad pública, y sus dos hijos D. 3 y 7 años D. edad. Ana tiene como profesión el ser costurera, ella se encarga D. confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes como familiares, amigos y vecinos, ya que la responsabilidad es una D. las mejorar cualidades D. ella. Ana elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas D. vestir para vender en su casa D. habitación, donD. también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo. Ana solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa, Ana posee la certeza q D. esta manera su negocio podrá mejorar y así obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana del Carmen S. D. P., age 39, lives in the Soyapango municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and her two children. Her husband works as a metropolitan agent in public security. Her two children are three and seven years old. Ana is a seamstress. She makes formal clothes, uniforms, and casual clothes. She is very detail oriented, and she does very good work. That allows her to have the loyalty of many customers like relatives, friends, and neighbors. Being responsible is one of her best qualities. Ana does work by order. She also makes articles of clothing to sell in her house, which is where she also does her work. Ana is requesting a loan to be able to buy fabrics of various styles and prints. She will also buy thread, needles, and everything needed to make clothes. Ana is sure that this way her business will be able to improve. She will then get greater earnings, which will be beneficial to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, and needles

loans.name: Cruz Emilda

texts.es: Cruz Emilda tiene 53 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio ella tiene que viajar hasta Managua para realizar las compras de sus productos, pues es aquí donde le resulta más favorable comprar al por mayor. Ella recomienda comprar una gran diversidad de productos así sus clientes tendrán diferentes productos que escoger, los cuales vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores e incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, vestidos, camisetas, calzado y cosméticos. Sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Cruz Emilda is 53 and sells clothing and cosmetics. She has done this for more than three years and she has to travel to Managua in order to buy her products, where it is easier to buy in bulk. She buys a large variety of products, and this way her clients have different products to choose from, which she sells in businesses in her community and the surrounding area, and customers come to her house. Her microenterprise has helped to improve the quality of life of her family considerably. The requested loan is for the purchase of basic materials like pants, dresses, shirts, footwear and cosmetics. She dreams of increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Las Pulguitas De Yumbel Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Pulguitas de Yumbel” and it is made up of 22 members (20 women and 2 men) from the city of Puerto Montt, Chile.  Their businesses are primarily fishing, selling used clothes, a dessert shop, a butcher shop and a perfume and accessories shop.

The group member interviewed was María, who is the president of the group. In the picture she is in the first row on the far right, wearing a green scarf and holding a white hat in her hand. She is an ambulatory used-clothes saleswoman. She sells in five different parts of the city, including at the flea market on Yumbel street on Sundays. She takes Tuesdays and Thursdays off.  

With her earnings, she helps economically support her family, which includes her husband, her daughter and the two young granddaughters who live with her.

María purchases her merchandise both in fairs and in stores. She plans on investing this loan in clothing and in curtains or other household fabrics. Her dream is to have a set locale from which to sell, in some part of the city.

María very much enjoys the support she receives from her Fondo Esperanza loan officer, and the atmosphere of trust that exists within her communal bank.  She also says that thanks to the loans she has received, she feels more secure in her business.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region.  The attractions of Puerto Montt are its beautiful green landscapes; its beaches, which are special because they do not have many tourists; its artisan crafts and goods; and its cuisine, especially its reputation for fish and seafood. Puerto Montt is also the port of entry to the Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: Used clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo D. is from the city of Potol, Dapitan. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Leonardo owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Leonardo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Leonardo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Yasimi

texts.en: Yasimi S. is currently in the business of selling bags of peeled dried cassava and maize at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of sorghum to sell. Yasimi is 45 years old and widowed. She has 6 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of sorghum to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man with one child from Lebanon. He has been working in the jewelry business for the past 23 years. He started his own business in 1991.  He works on a freelance basis, upon request of the clients, who have the option to choose any design from special catalogs. He also works for a local jewelry shops in his town.  

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al.  to invest in more materials for his work. He remains optimistic about the future and hopes to one day to open his own jewelry store and build a name for himself in this field. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in more materials for his jewelry business

loans.name: Nancy Yohanna

texts.es:
Nancy de 27 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber y vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra. 

Ella comenzó con el negocio del Cyber hace 5 años atrás, trabajando solo con una copiadora y una computadora, como en el sector por donde vive era mucha la demanda comenzó a comprar mas computadoras, así poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias hasta que pudo tener su propio local. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am, también recarga cartuchos de impresoras.  

Para dar una mejor atención a la clientela quiere comprar con el préstamo computadoras. En el futuro quiere terminar con éxito sus carrera de ingeniera en sistemas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old. She has a small "Cyber" and lives in the suburban zone of Guayaquil called "Fortín" characterized by povery and dirt roads.

She started the "Cyber" business 5 years ago working with a copy machine and a computer, but as there was a huge demand in the area she began to buy more computers, and little by little her profits increased and she got her own premises. Now she works from 6:00 am and she also refills print cartridges.

To offer better service to her customers she wants to buy computers with the loan. Her future plans are to finish successfully her studies in system engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en: Nowadays, at the time of global crisis, almost every country is in an unstable position. Even highly-developed, industrial, economically self-sufficient states are confronted by difficulties. It’s the same with the developing country, Kyrgyzstan. But it’s not a forcible argument to stop working, stop earning money and suffer losses. People want to live happily against all the odds. Damira K. is the leader of this group. She is 33. Together with her husband, who earns his livelihood by working as a private builder, she brings up four sons, all in school. Besides working in the sphere of passport documentation, Damira runs a family business. Thirteen years ago, having some money saved, she and her husband began their business. The very first step was starting to breed cattle; the second was to increase the number of cattle. With money received from the loan Damira wants to purchase more cattle. In the future, she wants to widen the shed to enable her to keep more cattle and, in order to improve the family’s housing conditions, make thorough house repairs. Damira's partners are: Aigul D., 29, a private entrepreneur, is married and has three children. She opened a shop after getting some money from her husband. Her aim is to extend her business. She wants to expand the assortment of goods and to make major shop repairs. Zarema K., 32, is married to a builder and has no children. She and her husband earn their living by selling goods in the market. After earning a profit, they bought a refrigerator and a washing machine. The aim of the loan is to expand her assortment of goods. In future she hopes to rent a container. Kauhar M., 30, is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has five children. She began her business with selling ice-cream. As the business developed, she also began to sell disks and audio cassettes. Her aim is to extend her business. She intents to finish a new house she is building. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Bolivar Antonio

texts.es:
Bolívar Antonio R. M. tiene 43 años.  Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos de 22, 20, 16, 13, 11, 8, y 6 anos. 

Antonio es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo. 
Antonio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, trigo, cebada, y alverja. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Pablo cada 8 dias.  

Solicita el préstamo para comprar los abonos, las semillas, y los insumos para producir en su agricultura. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara en trabajar para ayudar a sus hijos. Su meta para los anos proximos es progresar mas en la agricultura. Este ano las lanchas han sido fuertes y se han afectado un gran porcentaje de sus cultivos de maíz. 

Le gusta jugar el boli.
texts.en:
Bolívar Antonio R. M. is 43 years old.  He is married and lives in the San Miguel canton of the Bolívar province.  He has seven children; ages 22, 20, 16, 13, 11, 8, and 6.

Antonio is a member of the San Isidro Communal Bank, which is located one and a half hours from San Miguel.  There are ten members in all, and most of them grow corn and wheat.

Antonio is a farmer, and he grows corn, wheat, barley, and peas.  He buys and sells his products in San Pablo every eight days.

He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and the agricultural products needed for production.  The support from the loan will help in work in order to help his children.  His goal for the coming years is to make more agricultural progress.  The crop diseases have been strong this year, and they have affected a large percentage of his corn crop.

He likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: To buy compost, seeds, and liquid fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is the mother of three school-aged children. She has been running an education business from her home since 2007. She has prepared a special education room to receive the students. Her income is important for her husband and children, especially for paying her own children's school fees. Today, she is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay schooling registrations for her three children. Her only aim is to be able to ensure a good education for her children so that they are able to reach university.

loans.use: To pay school registration fees for her three children

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem belongs to Lahore, which is a capital of the Punjab province and the second largest city of Pakistan. She lives in the area called Mughalpura with her family in a two-room brick house. She moved here five years ago. 

A very talented lady, Naseem owns and operates a clothes sewing business at her home. The sewing business is a very demanding business in Lahore because Lahore is also famous for its new fashion trends. She mainly gets orders from her neighborhood clients. She offers them quality services, which gives her a good return in the form of money.
  
Her husband sells shawls (a kind of cloth worn over shoulders and body). He has a small shop in the market where he specifically sells these shawls. He sells different kinds of shawls, such as embroidered, simple and colorful. He imports the shawls from Multan city at cheap rates and sells them through his shop for a good profit.  

Naseem is the mother of six children. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver and the one next to him is a property dealer. The last four children are enrolled in a school and are getting their education. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will buy shawls with the loan amount. He has been doing this business for over seven years and Naseem is hopeful that the loan will bring positive changes to his business. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit record and never missed any meetings.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy shawls for a shawls selling business

loans.name: Awa Ablowa

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Awa est mariée et a 3 enfants en charge. Pour aider son mari au foyer, fait la vente des produits d’alimentations générale . Elle fait 10 ans dans cette activité. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’agoe assiyéyé. Elle a eu des prêts qui sont remboursés . Pour repondre au mieux à la demande, elle sollicite un credit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz et 2 bidond d’huile.
texts.en: 50 years old, Awa is married with three dependent children. IN order to help her husband provide for the family, she sells  general food products. She has been in this business for 10 years. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells at the local market of Agoe Assiyéyé. She had prior loans, all duly repaid. In order to better meet customer demand, she is seeking a loan to purchase five bags of rice and two jugs of oil.

loans.use: Purchasing general food products

loans.name: Mukwano Kwagalana Development - Kampala Group

texts.en:
Lawrance K., 54, has been running a brick-selling business in Kito-Kampala for a decade now. It is a business he says he began with his own initiative after rearing and selling livestock.  

Lawrence says he is married with 13 kids, three of whom are in school. He says this business venture generates 280,000 shillings monthly. With this loan, he says he is going to buy firewood for burning his bricks. 

K. belongs to the Mukwano Kwagalana Group - Kampala.

loans.use: The purchase of firewood for burning his bricks

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: Nelli V. has been trading in clothes since 1998. Nelli’s husband has gone to Russia for work purposes and Nelli is the main caretaker of her two children. Nelli has applied for the loan to purchase pre-holiday season clothing.

loans.use: To purchase pre-holiday season clothing.

loans.name: Insherah

texts.en:
Insherah is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Insherah is a mother of two sons and is married to Yousef who is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Insherah and Yousef run a small grocery store which helps them increase their income as NPA salaries are small. Insherah came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase a larger amount of goods to sell in the store.

Insherah is a conservative woman, like most Gaza citizens, and doesn't want her picture posted online. Therefore you see her husband Yousef in the picture above.

About this loan product:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety and amount of goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Elvis Edward

texts.es: El Sr. Elvis es casado vive en la zona de pacata baja urb. Vive en casa propia tiene un hijo pequeño su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica  al cuidado de su hijita,  el se dedica al transporte tiene su movilidad propia trabaja como taxista libre desde hace 5 años es su principal fuente de ingreso para la subsistencia de su familia el saco el crédito para compra de repuestos y algunas mejoras para su movilidad es nuevo en la institución y con el crédito kiva el cliente se fue muy satisfecho , el es muy trabajador siempre velando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Elvis is married and lives in the Pacata Baja Urb zone. He lives in his own home and has a small child. his wife is a housewife and takes care of their little daughter. Elvis works in transportation. He has his own vehicle and has worked as a taxi driver for 5 years. This is his main source of income for his family, and he is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts and some improvements for his vehicle. He is new to the institution and has been very satisfied with the Kiva credit. He is a very hard-working person, always working for his family's well-being.

loans.use: the purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group A-Kihihi

texts.en:
37-year-old Christmas H. is a happily married father of 5.  He has been in the farming and coffee selling business for the last 3 years. H. is a  traveling business man who carries himself around with a lot of optimism. He is a firm believer that hard work pays. Because he wants to make the most out of his business, he incessantly travels long distances to sell his coffee to old and new customers alike. He also sells to cooperative unions around Kihihi district. He says he began this business with savings from a modest crude alcohol selling business. Monthly, this business generates for him 350,000 shillings.   With this loan, H. says he is going to purchase more bags of coffee to resell. 

H. belongs to Bugongi United savings and credit group-Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase coffee to resell

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long H., age 50, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fishermen. She currently earns an average of US $1.60 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. Her husband is 48 years old and is a local farmer and fisherman who works along a local river.

Long H. is the mother of six children, two of whom are single and four are married. One of her children is a motor-taxi (known locally as a tuk tuk) driver in and around Phnom Penh City, and his existing motor often breaks while running his business. To support her son's motor-taxi service, Long H. would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) in order to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Bernandina

texts.es:
Bernandina es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Santa Julia de Ibedia del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de seis años y gracias a la buena atención que brinda tiene clientela fidelizada. La actividad que realiza es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de el se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Bernandina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerveza ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a mother, 42 years old, who lives with her husband and her three children in the town of Santa Julia de Ibedia. It is in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She sells beer from her home. She has had this business for more than six years, and because of the good service she provides, she has happy customers. This business is of much help to her family; because of it she is able to help her family with economic needs. 

Bernardina would like to expand her business by buying more beer because the demand for her business has grown. She has requested a loan of PEN 1,000.00, with which she plans to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy beer to expand her business

loans.name: Yarling

texts.es:
Yarling del Rosario A. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa de diferentes estilos en camisas, blusas, pantalones, Capri, chores… etc. en lo que invertirá el crédito.
Ella tiene tres hijos  dos gemelas de 19 años quienes están en la universidad y un niño de 11 que está en primaria. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y prosperar.
texts.en: Yarling del Rosario A. is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who sells different styles of clothing such as shirts, blouses, pants, capris, shorts, etc., which she will use the loan to buy.  She has three children, two 19-year-old twin girls who are in college, and one 11-year-old boy who is in primary school.  Her greatest dream is that her children move forward and prosper.

loans.use: For clothing

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El señor Máximo es chofer y trabaja en el sindicato de transporte de Pasajeros Eduardo Avaroa del cual es dirigente y percibe un salario; el crédito lo requiere para comprar repuestos para su vehiculo como ser llantas de auxilio y comprar un motor nuevo;  su esposa es comerciante y con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. Vive en casa  propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Maximo es casado y tiene cinco hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Maximo is a driver and his part of the passenger transport union "Eduardo Avaroa", which he directs and receives a salary from.  The loan is needed to buy replacement parts for his vehicles such as spare tires, and to buy a new motor.  His wife is a saleswoman and with their incomes they are able to maintain themselves.  They live in their own home which is located in the zone of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  Maximo is married and has 5 children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy spare tires and a motor for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a single woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a community building that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing teaching materials.

For the past seven years, Rachel has operated a school, teaching students from her neighboring community. Rachel faces a major challenge of delayed monthly payments of school fees by parents. She dreams of renovating her school building in the future.

Rachel wants to use this 30,000 KES loan to purchase school materials, such as books, for her students. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase school materials for her students.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila, posee un negocio donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, residen en Concepción Batres departamento D. Usulután, el negocio surgió por iniciativa propia junto a su esposo, el horario D. trabajo es D. 6:00am a 7:00pm, para atenderlo Zoila cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, especialmente pastas, salsas, arroz, frijoles y aceite, esta compra le permitirá crecer en su inventario  y tener la mercadería necesaria para los clientes.
Su objetivo es surtir el negocio D. la mercadería más demandada, atendiendo mejor a los clientes y garantizando una mejor solvencia económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila owns a business where she sells household essentials.  She lives with her husband and two children in Concepción Batres, in Usulután department.  Zoila set up her business, together with her husband, through her own initiative.  She works from 6.00am to 7.00pm and her children help her out in the store.

Zoila is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, especially pasta, sauces, rice, beans and oil.  This purchase will allow her to increase her stock and have available the merchandise her customers need.

Zoila's goals are to stock her business with the merchandise that is in most demand, to better serve her customers and to guarantee financial solvency for her family.

loans.use: to buy pasta, sauces, rice, beans and oil

loans.name: Duo El Misperal Group

texts.es:
Duo el Misperal: Doña Marta Lilia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras por mayor en el mercado de su comunidad ella nos cuenta que viaja a otros departamento dos veses por semana para vender su producto de primera calidad ella nos cuenta que nececita su credito para la compra de frutas y verduras ya que ella deci que nececita mas capital para trabajar.
Doña Maricela se dedica a la venta de flores ella nos cometa que es una venta que le a hayudado mucho ya que a logrado sacar adelante a su familia ella nos dice que nececita el credito para la compra de flores ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
Marta Lilia sells fruit and vegetables wholesale in the market in her community.  She tells us that she travels to other departments twice a week to sell her top-quality products.  She says that she needs this loan to buy fruit and vegetables because she needs more capital to be able to work.

Maricela sells flowers.  She tells us that her business has helped her a lot as she has managed to get her family ahead in life.  She says that she needs her loan to buy flowers as she needs more capital to work.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables and to buy flowers

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a married man and has 2 children, all of whom had graduated from school.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past 27 years, Reuben has owned rental houses and rents them to travelers and local tenants.  He also has a business distributing drinking water, which adds to his income.   Reuben faces a major challenge of competition and seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 40,000,  Reuben wants to purchase water pipes for his water distribution business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes for his water distribution business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and has had a food selling business for 15 years. Myrna sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, squash, onions and garlic to generate more income. In the future, Myrna hopes to have a big business, achieve financial independence and provide progressive living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, squash, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Jose Ausberto

texts.en: Jose is 55 years old and married with three children.  He lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras where he has worked as a taxi driver for 25 years.  Jose is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 with which to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.use: This loan will be used for engine repairs to Jose's taxi.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 58 years of age.  She is widowed and has 9 children. She has been growing rice for almost 30 years.  From her last crop, she received a net income of 25,000 PHP.

Tita is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings, insecticides, and fertilizers. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: buy seedlings, insecticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with four children, two of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and fuel.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of inadequate stock in his business. Abdalla dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kshs, he plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sacks of beans and detergents for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sacks of beans and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia tiene 22 años de edad, convive con Lázaro que también 26 años, con quien tiene un hijo, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Celedonia es una mujer perseverante en sus quehaceres, es por esta razón que viene  obteniendo sus objetivos trazados. Ella es trabajadora del municipio, donde brinda servicios de limpieza. Esta a gusto con su trabajo por que gracias a ello puede ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que también aporta en la canasta familiar. En un futuro próximo piensa abrir un pequeño restaurante, de esta manera desea ser independiente, por que en el barrio por donde vive no existe un servicio de este rubro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará muebles para acondicionar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Celedonia is 22 years old and lives with 26 year-old Lázaro.  The couple have one son.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.

Celedonia is a woman who determinedly does her work.  For this reason, she is achieving the goals that she has set herself.  She works for the council, providing cleaning services.  She enjoys her work because it enables her to help with her household expenses.  She has the support of her husband who also contributes to the family's expenses.  In the near future, she plans to open a small restaurant so that she be self employed.  There is currently no business of this type in the neighborhood where she lives.

This is Celedonia's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy furniture to set up her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 2, 15 y 16 años  en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Le gusta jugar vóley.
texts.en:
José Luis, 52, is married and lives with his wife and children of two, 15 and 16 years of age in the Chillanes hamlet, province of Bolívar. 

The Nueve de Abril [April 9th] communal bank is located the San José de Tambo parish belonging to the Chillanes hamlet. The members of this group work in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of corn and cocoa.  

José is a corn and cocoa farmer. He buys and sells his products in the San José de Tambo market. 

He is seeking the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops. The loan will help him supply his economic necessities and improve the quality of his farming business. He faces challenges such as falling prices in the products he sells, as well as the intermediaries. His dream is that his children would be professionals. 

He likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Vicenta Isabel

texts.es: señora Vicenta  es  cliente nuevo será su primera secuencia,  tiene  tres hijos, y su esposo se llama Rafael juntos trabajan  en la decoración de interiores  y re tapizados de muebles, les va muy bien en su actividad,  la cliente vive  en la zona achachicala,  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra  de  tela por  mayor y  cuero por rollos estos materiales  le servirán para su trabajo, la Sra. Vicenta esta muy contenta por trabajar junto a su esposo sin descuidar a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Vicenta is a new client and it will be her first loan cycle. She has three children and her husband's name is Rafael. They work together in providing interior decorating services and upholstery services and their business is doing very well. She lives in the region of Achachicala. She will invest her loan in the purchase of fabrics in wholesale and rolls of leather. These are materials that will help her in her work. Vicenta is very happy to be able to work together with her husband without having to neglect her family. She is a very hardworking person and she is thankful with the institution for their support.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in wholesale and rolls of leather.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy, 43, lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, with her family. She is married and has two children age 19 and 18.

Daisy is a farmer. She has been growing and selling rice for five years. Daisy does her best to support her family. She hopes to have enough capital to start another business.

Daisy has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is from Samtredia, Imereti District. He is 44 years old and lives with his family: wife – Inga, 5 year old son, 4 year old daughter and 73 year old mother (retired).
