The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. In particular, they grow 500 nut trees and 100 vine trees on a family-owned 0.5 hectare piece of land. Khvicha sells harvested nuts and grapes at the local market. Grapes are sold in fall and nuts are sold in late winter and early spring, as their price reaches maximum by that time. 

Khvicha has requested credit to purchase nuts. He will process and sell them, together with his harvest, in late winter/early spring for the higher price. He will get additional income, which will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase nuts to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: El señor  Santos en un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, habita junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Santos desde hace años se dedica al cultivo de piña y pitahaya la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos ; ya que estos son su fuente de ingresos para su familia , los planes futuros es poder establecer diversos cultivos de cítricos para obtener ingresos extras . Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para que muchos agricultores como él puedan realizar a tiempo la inducción al cultivo para mejora la calidad y sobre todo su sabor natural.
texts.en: Santos is a humble farmer from Ticuantepe.  He lives with his wife and children.  His plan for his family is to provide them with better living conditions.  Santos has been growing pineapple and dragon fruit for several years.  The greatest challenge he faces is not having enough economic resources to provide better care for his crops since they are his family’s source of income.  Plans for the future are to be able to plant various citrus fruits to earn extra income.  He is thankful for the support and trust that Afodenic gives through Kiva funds to many farmers like him to be able to start planting on time to improve the quality and, above all, the natural flavor of their crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is married and a father of three.  It has been one year since he started practicing poultry farming.  He has employed one person in the business.  He has grown the business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  His desire is to farm on a large scale in five years.
Chrispine has requested 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Tungishbai

texts.en: Tungishbai is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife and eldest son help with his business. His younger two children are in school and kindergarten. He started his butcher shop in 2007 by renting a counter in a market. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to buy livestock before prices get high. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I need to go to rural areas and buy some livestock before prices get high." He is requesting 1,650,000 MNT to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Yasmina Patricia

texts.es: Yasmina de 36 años de edad, se dedica una de las actividades mas populares propias de la cuidad de León, es dueña de una pulpería la cual la tiene localizada en su casa de habitación, es madre de dos hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos esta cursando su tercer año de la secundaria y el mas pequeño esta en la primaria. Ella empezó su  negocio hace dos años, ella vendió un terreno que tenia con ese dinero empezó a comprar mercadería de vender tenia muy pocos productos pero fue creciendo poco a poco convirtiéndose en su medio de subsistencia,  en la cual trabaja junto con su esposo además es una opción  que tiene el no tener trabajo. De esta manera es como saca adelante a su familia día a día. Ella requiere  el préstamo para comprar productos tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, enlatados, cosméticos, leche, huevo, jugos, dulces quiere invertir también en compra de  ropa para aprovechar la época navideña y vender. Esta inversión le ayudara adquirir los productos que mas demandan tiene y mejorar sus ingresos. Una de sus expectativas es mejorar la infraestructura a su negocio, ir componiendo su casa poco a poco para darles un hogar digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yasmina is 36 years old, and works in one of the most popular fields in the city of León, that of being the owner of a home-based grocery store. She is the mother of 2 children of 15 and 17 years old. The older child is in the third year of high school and the younger is in elementary school.

She began her business some 2 years ago. She sold a piece of property that she had and with that money she began to buy merchandise to sell. She had very few products but was growing little by little transforming this into her way of making a living, in which she works together with her husband as an option when he has no work.

In this way she her family has prospered from day to day. She is asking for a loan in order to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, canned food, cosmetics, milk, eggs, juices, sweets and also wants to invest by buying clothing in order to take advantage of the Christmas season sales. This investment will help her buy the products that are most requested and to increase her income. One of her hopes is to improve the infrastructure of her business, repairing her home little by little in order to give her children a decent home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, canned goods, cosmetics, milk, eggs, juice, and sweets and to also invest in clothing purchases in order to take advantage of the Christmas season sales

loans.name: Union Palmeras Y Pinos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VUNIÓN PALMERAS Y PINOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Tecla. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de mantas, venta de chompas, tejidos de mantas, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de polleras, venta de alfombras. 

La señora Tecla  indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas y chompas que trabaja hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de una de una hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de lana), que adquirirá de las ferias y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializara en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "UNIÓN PALMERAS Y PINOS” ["Union of Palms and Pines"] is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo Center. It is mde up of eight members, and it is led by an executive board, headed by Tecla. The businesses carried out by the communal bank members are varied, including selling blankets, selling sweaters, weaving blankets, selling baby clothes, selling t-shirts, and selling rugs. 

Tecla indicates that she became a member of Pro Mujer two cycles ago, on the invitation of the promoters. Currently, she has a business making and selling blankets and sweaters. She has run this business for quite a few years, and she learned it from one of her sisters. 

The loan that she is now requesting is to increase her stock of merchandise by buying wool, which she will purchase from the markets. After making her products, she will sell them at her sales stand. This business allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is single and has four children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is a farmer. His food sales business in the busy and flourishing Kyenjojo food market is now two years old. He not only sells to food businessmen and women from his district, but to those who come from other neighboring districts. This has enabled him to solidify on his finances. Weekly his sales returns total UGX 30,000. 

 It goes without saying that this has been Leonidas' business's tower of strength in the sense that he harvests what he sells. Selling what he harvests has enabled him to cut down on unwanted expenditure. The father of two says he has steered clear of food purchase expenditures.

He intends to use his Kiva loan to purchase high grade manure for his farms.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for his farms.

loans.name: Horm's Group

texts.en:
Horm, 42, is a married mother of six children, several of whom are still in school. She has been growing maize, pepper, and sesame for nearly thirty years to make a living. Sometimes she works for others to generate additional income. 

After three loan cycles with VisionFund, Horm has regular income to sufficiently feed her children and is able to send her children to school. Now she and her group members, who are just with VisionFund, are requesting a loan. She wants to buy crop seeds for her farm and will use some of the loan to pay for labor to plow her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her business and earn a larger income to live better.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds for her farm and use some of the loan to pay for labor to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny Patricia tiene 32 años vive en unión libre, vive con el compañero  y sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años.  Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.
Fanny  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  tener un terreno para seguir invirtiendo.

En el tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión y dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fanny Patricia is 32 years old. She lives with her domestic partner and their two children, ages 10 and 8.She lives in Recinto America in the Canton of Ventanas.

The group UNIDOS VENCEREMOS ("Together we will Overcome") is located in Recinto America, in the Canton of Ventanas. The group works in the agricultural sector, specifically in the short-cycle harvest of corn and rice.

Fanny has been working growing corn for 3 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market there.

She is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow her corn and rice. The loan will help her to increase her income to help her family and also to reinvest. Her dream is to have property in order to continue investing.

In her free time, Fanny likes to watch television and spend time with her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 7 Group

texts.en:
Lisa is taking another loan from VisionFund Indonesia. The previous loan helped her to contribute income for her family and helped her husband. At this time, she wants to use her part of loan to pay for more cell phone minutes refills. When she sells food items, she tries to sell cell phone minute refills and have a lot of customers. 

Before, her group had four members, but now her group only has three members.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone minute refills to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has 4 children. She is a fish monger at Asebu Ekroful. She has been operating this business for 4 years. Her husband is a trader. Efua will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits, efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура очень благодарно за Вашу искреннюю поддержку. Она с Вашей помощи до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свое любимое дело. У Манзуры увеличилось количество клиентов. Она хочет взять кредит и расширить деятельность. За счет кредита она купить ткани для шитья мешков и сумки. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей сохранить деятельность. Мавзуна верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли больше ткани.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to buy varieties of vegetables for grocery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to renovate her rental houses and add stock to her business

loans.name: Shole

texts.en: Shole A. is 45 years old, she is married and has two children. She sells women’s clothes in her small rented place in the Sabirabad center bazaar since 1999. Mrs. A. borrowed a $1200 USD loan to broaden her small business and she plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make her store even bigger and begin to sell men’s clothes.

loans.use: Mrs. Agayeva would like to broaden her small business and begin to sell men’s clothes.

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.en: Egamberdi E. is 72 years old and is married with 4 children.  He lives in the Yavan district and has a secondary education.  Egamberdi grow up in a village so animal restocking skills is easy for him.  All his life he worked on a collective farm with cattle. He enjoyed his work which gives him an advantage. Nowadays he is in retirement so he devotes all his time for cattle breeding. By borrowing $1000 he is going to buy 3 bull-calves and feed.  This loan helps locals obtain meat for a low price.  Egamberdi plans to pay off the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: to buy 3 bull calves for breeding and selling

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Phon is a widow with 3 children - a son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her elder relatives in 1967, and started her weaving business that same year. During the Khmer Rough regime she temporarily stopped weaving and continued only in 1979. Mrs. C. also trained her eldest daughter in the silk-weaving art, who has been assisting her in the business since 2002. Mrs. C. currently owns 2 looms - one for herself and another one for her daughter.    

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$600 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for her and her daughter's loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for looms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of materials

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is a married, 47-year-old mother of 2. She and her husband own a furniture and upholstery business. She would like to expand her business, and in order to contribute to its growth, she is requesting a loan so that she may purchase the materials necessary for manufacturing furniture, thus being able to move forward and establish their business as a prosperous one in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 niños; y junto con su marido tiene un negocio de elaboración de muebles y tapicería en general. Desea que su negocio crezca, y como parte de ese crecimiento solicita su crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus muebles y así poder seguir adelante y poder establecer su tapicería como un negocio próspero en el barrio Memorial Sandino.

loans.use: Purchase of upholstery materials

loans.name: Glenda Rebeca

texts.es:
Doña Glenda is 48-years-old, is married, and has 2 children, one who is in primary school, and one who is in secondary school. She lives in Unidad in Managua. In her home, she has a small store where she sells clothing, perfume, shoes, and cosmetics for women. She started this business 4 years ago in search of another source of income for her family and to support her husband, who is an auto mechanic. Doña Glenda hopes to invest in clothing for men and children, since she wants to expand her line of products and to attract a larger number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Glenda tiene 48 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos de edad, en escuela primaria y secundaria. habita en Unidad de propósito de managua. En la vivienda la señora tiene una pequeña venta, la cual consiste en ropa, perfume, zapatos y cosméticos para damas. Este negocio lo inició hace 4 años en busca de otra fuente de ingresos para la familia y apoyar a su esposo que es mecánico automotriz. Doña Glenda desea invertir en ropa para caballeros y niños, ya que desea expandir sus lineas de productos y así captar mayor números de clientes.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for men and children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer, hair and skin products, chemicals, and towels and to install a water boiler

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Mr. Manh M. is a 43-year-old farmer and fish seller in Daun La Or Village, Kampong Thom Province. He earns an average of $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Van Vet, is 36 years old and also farms and sells fish, earning about $2 per day. M. has four children, two of whom work in a garment factory and provide their family about $2 per day. Mr. M. is now requesting a $1,200 loan to buy a motorcycle for his business transportation. With his fish-selling business, he can increase his income so he can support his children’s studies and help reduce his family’s expenses. M. thanks Kiva for their support and promises prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his business transportation

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 42 years old and is married with one child (who is 24 years old). Khadija is a fish whosaler. She started her business in 1998. She works from 6am to 6pm at her business every day. She earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Khadija has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Assisatou

texts.en:
Assiatou Combé D. lives in the Kolda region of Senegal. She is 56 years old and married with two children under her care. She has been a member of the Samba 15ANS village bank for six years.

She is asking for this loan to purchase food items and traditional brooms to sell, and also to cover the costs of transportation to her sales sites. She has a very strong savings account balance and is happy to be approved for this next loan. This loan is for a duration of six months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanut butter, limes, and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 30 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2003, is a skillful woman. Realizing her ability, she chose to become a tailor. Joining the Fund, she used the borrowed money in buying fabric material. Currently, she is owning a tailor shop. Her customers are very satisfied with her products. They come to her shop very often, especially youths. She is famous not only locally but is well-known to people in town as well. She is having a stable income, of 200 USD/ month. She has 2 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 725 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhật 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003, là người phụ nữ khéo tay hay làm. Chị đã nhận thấy những điểm mạnh của mình nên ngày từ khi chưa lấy chồng chị đã lựa chọn cho mình một nghề phù hợp đó là nghề may, tham gia vào Quỹ và tích cực vay vốn, các vòng vốn vay chị đều đầu tư vào mua vải. Hiện nay chị đã có một của hàng may quần áo tại nhà, với bản chất kheo tay sẵn có nên các sảm phẩm chị may đều được khách hàng hài lòng, khách hàng đến của hàng may của chị rất đông, đặc biệt là ở các lứa tuổi thanh niên, không chỉ là các khách hàng ở trong xã chị biết đến mà thậm chí cả những khách hàng ngoài xã cũng tìm đến cửa hàng chị để may. Với việc làm ăn như vậy kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định, chị co 2 con đang ở độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 12.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Tailoring

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov C. is a villager in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer who harvests her crop twice a year. During the rainy season Mrs. Pov C. cultivates rice, and she grows vegetables in the dry season. Her husband, Mr. Phal Noeurn, assists his wife with the farming.

Mrs. Pov C. is 32-years-old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school. The youngest is too young to work or study. Her family lives under poor conditions because Mrs. Pov C. and her husband currently make a small income. Their house is old. Thus, she is now requesting a loan to buy equipment to build a new house. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy equipment to build a new house.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida Baji is the wife of B. A. who makes steel-body cooking ranges. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. He learnt this art from his father and chose this work as a profession.

Abida Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has been living with her family in a city named Lahore, Paksitan for the last 30 years. She owes a three-room brick house. She is a mother of twelve children: eight sons and four daughters. Her first four sons work with their father while the remaining four sons are studying. She is applying for a loan to buy more steel to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy steel to make cooking stoves

loans.name: Chrich

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrich C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Keo Um, 42, live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. Three of their children are garment factory workers and other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Chrich has been selling fruit and Cambodian cake at a market in Phnom Penh for a few years. Before starting this business she used to be a silk weaver. Mr. Keo has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill he learned from a villager. He sells his finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Currently, Chich needs to expand her fruit-selling business but lacks the money.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fruits for resale and to buy silk materials for her husband's weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing fruit to sell and buying silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso además de que le gusta mucho la repostería y las ventas, ya que es una actividad que aprendió hace muchos años porque su familia se dedicaba a eso. Comenzó a elaborar y vender pan hace 20 años, en aquel entonces su familia tenía una panadería establecida la cual cerraron hace dos años por la avanzada edad de su papá que ya no podía trabajar y fue cuando decidió a elaborar el pan en su casa y venderlo a domicilio, lo cual le gusta hacer y en la actualidad me ha ido muy bien y ya tiene muchos clientes. Con el anterior crédito de KIVA pudo comprar materiales para elaborar el pan y con este crédito que esta solicitando quiere aprovechar la época de frío que se acerca y en donde sus productos tienen mas demanda.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir materia prima, recipientes y moldes que le permitan elaborar más pan y atender mejor a sus clientes que en esta época de frío que se acerca demandan mas producto.
texts.en:
Margarita started her business out of necessity, and she enjoys baking and sales. She learned to bake many years ago because it is her family trade. She began to bake and sell bread 20 years ago, when her family had an established bakery. It was closed two years ago because her father was getting old and couldn't work. This was when Margarita decided to bake bread in her home and sell it door to door. She likes this work and the business has gone well. Margarita has many clients. With her previous loan through Kiva Margarita bought cooking supplies to make bread, and now she'd like a loan to increase production because she expects more demand during winter. Margarita needs a loan of US $400, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy raw materials, containers and molds that will help her make more bread. She'll be able to better serve her clients during the winter when demand is greater.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha S. is 50 years old and lives in Dar es Salaam. She is married and has four children, all between the ages of 20 and 34. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants. 
Mwanaisha is a wonderful woman who has devoted her career to the care and education of Tanzania's youth. She nurtures young children and prepares them to enter elementary school. Mwanaisha is very dedicated, working 9 to 12 hours a day, 5 days a week. At present, she needs a loan of US$250 in order to make renovations to the nursery school, for instance, by purchasing and installing additional desks for her students. Mwanaisha is thankful to everyone for their support.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Renovations to a nursery school

loans.name: Siguidja Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SIGUIDJA sont des femmes mariées qui vivent dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne 39 ans et 5  enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens d’amitié et de famille et résident toutes dans la sous- préfecture de Ouéléssébougou située à 80  kilomètres de Bamako capitale du Mali (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ce groupe s’est spécialisé dans la fabrication et la vente du Sounbala un produit alimentaire très apprécié et recherché pour la préparation des sauces en Afrique de l’ouest. Elles ont appris la fabrication du Sounbala dès le bas âge auprès de leurs mères c'est-à-dire  une somme de connaissance séculaire transmise de génération en génération. En effet les grains néré une fois proprement lavés, sont bouillies, pilés et ensuite pétries afin d’avoir la pâte alimentaire noirâtre appelée SOUNBALA à laquelle plusieurs formes sont données. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
Elles  sollicitent ce prêt de 100 000 FCFA membre, pour acheter,  600  kilogrammes de grains de néré (fruit d’un arbre oléagineux de la région sahélienne) et de bois de chauffe pour la cuisson des noix. 
Le cycle de production et de vente effective dure en moyenne trois (3) semaines. Le Sounbala fini est acheminé sur Bamako souvent sur le Sénégal pour être vendu en espèce souvent à crédit. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen par cycle de 33.000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour essentiellement renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the group SIGUIDJA are married women who live in polygamous households and who average 39 years of age and five children. The know one another by ties of friendship and family, and they all reside in the sub-prefecture of Ouéléssébougou, located 80 km from the Bamako, the capital of Mali (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group is specialized in making and selling "sounbala", a highly-appreciated food product that is sought after for making sauces in West Africa.

They learned how to make sounbala at an early age from their mothers. In other words, it's about an ancient body of knowledge passed down from generation to generation. Basically, the néré seeds, once they are properly cleaned, are boiled, pounded, and then kneaded in order to make a dark, edible dough called 'sounbala', which is formed into several different shape.

The group members are on their fourth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women are requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA each to buy 600 kg of néré seeds (the fruit of an oil-producing tree in the Sahel region) and firewood for cooking the seeds.

The production cycle and actual sales occur over the course of three weeks. The finished sounbala is taken to Bamako and often to Senegal to be sold in cash and often on credit. The group members hope to realize an average per-cycle profit of 33,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to boost their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré seeds

loans.name: Maria Makyao's Group

texts.en:
Maria M., age 45, is married with four children ages 22, 20, 12 and 10. She has a tailoring business, which she started in 1994 and she works from 1pm until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $150.

This will be Maria’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open another business, a genge (food stand) where she sells tomatoes, vegetables, rice, sugar, beans and wheat flour. She will use her fifth loan to increase stock on the genge and buy more materials.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group, Upendo Mloganzila, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Maria is sitting in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: To buy more materials and increase stock for a food stand.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian A. is a 28-year-old married mother of 2 school-going children. She lives in Nyamasaria, Kisumu, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a tailoring and dressmaking business which she initiated in the year 2000. She also helps her husband run a retail shop.

Lillian specializes in making both women’s dresses and men’s shirts. Due to her hard work, years of experience, well-established client base and financial assistance from KMET, she has seen her business grow. She plans to use a half of her loan of US $275 to purchase new patterns and materials so as to cope with changing fashions in the market and also meet the growing demand for her clothing.

loans.use: Purchase patterns and other new dressmaking materials

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, del Barrio Progreso, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (primer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica a la comercialización D. abarrote al por menor.
Su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc.) 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que será pagado en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mercaderías para su negocio (arroz por sacos, azúcar pos saco, aceite por galones, golosinas, etc.), ella desea auto sostenerse, por ello todas sus ganancias las invierte en ella, debido a su edad, puesto que sus hijos tienen su familia y se encuentran lejos D. ella.  
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos, por brindarle su ayuda y poder acceder a estas facilidades para poder seguir trabando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Banco Comunal "03 D. Mayo." She lives in the Progreso neighborhood, within the Collao province and Ilave district, insiD. the department of Puno. She's 76 years old (with a first-graD. education), widowed, and has 4 children. She's worked with the Manuela Ramos MFI for 4 years, during which time she has dedicated herself to the retail sale of groceries. Her first loan (300 soles) was used to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.) for her business. With this second loan for 1500 soles ($475 dollars), which she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise (sacks of rice and sugar, gallon containers of cooking oils, candies, etc.) She hopes to become fully self-sustainable, which is why she always re-invests her additional profits back into her business (she can afford to do this due both to her age and to the fact that her children now live far away with their own families). Rosa is extremely thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to be able to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Scuratcov

texts.en: I. is 32 years old and works as a truck driver.  He likes this work because even as a child he dreamed of driving big trucks cross country and having the opportunity to see many beautiful places. A few weeks ago his truck developed problems with the electronic system. This presents a big problem for I., because now it is risky for him to drive. With a loan from Microinvest he can repair the truck and be ready to go again.

loans.use: to repair electronic system

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Yadira C. se dedica a su actividad de venta de bebidas las cuales comercializa en su localidad en la ciudad de León donde labora arduamente todos los días por el motivo de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de sus productos y es por esta razón que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito porque le urge la compra de las bebidas para comercializarlas y así mejorar su nivel de vida en su localidad.
texts.en:
Yadira Chavez sells drinks in her neighborhood in the city of Leon, where she works hard every day to support her family. The reason that she has approached Ceprodel is that she hopes to receive a loan to buy a wider variety of beverages for her store so that she can increase sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Caren Anyango

texts.en: Caren Anyango O. is a 26-year-old mother of three children who are 8, 6, and 4 years old. All her children are in school. She lives and works in Kasawino, just outside Kisumu. She is married to a "hawker" (someone who sells small items on the street). Caren runs her own small shop where she sells oil, flour, and homemade chapati. She is asking for 30,000 KES to increase her food stock.

loans.use: Buy oil, flour, and chapati to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: N. Annet is an energetic lady, age 34, with two kids. She has operated a boutique since 2003. Her business has been running well, and she has been thinking of expansion. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes for her boutique as well as expanding it. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale and to expand her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 25 años de edad, es casada, ella tiene dos hijos, el primero ya estudia su preprimaria, y la otra aun no.   Su esposo trabaja y le ayuda con su gasto de la familia, y también le ayuda en su negocio algunas veces. Hace aproximadamente 3 años y medio empezó un negocio de venta de frutas,  luego empezó otro negocio venta de ropa típica como güipiles y cortes.  Ella vende sus productos los días de mercados que son los miércoles y domingo de cada semana, en la plaza municipal su localidad.  El crédito que ella  solicita es para invertir y surtir su negocio comprando más mercadería como delantales y suéteres, porque es la época de ello.  Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y poder conseguir un local en la plaza municipal, también para tener una mejor vida con sus hijos ahora que están pequeños.
texts.en:
Isabel is 25 years old. She is married and she has two children. The first is still studying in preparatory school, and the other is not. Her husband works and he helps her with the expenses of the family, and also he sometimes helps her in her business. It has been about three and a half years since she began a business selling fruit. Later she began another business selling traditional clothing like güipiles and shorts. She sells products on market days, or on Wednesdays and Sundays of each week, in the city plaza of her area. The loan that she is asking for is to invest in and stock her business, buying more merchandise like aprons and sweaters, because it’s the season for them. Her dream is to grow her business and to be able to get a location in the city plaza, and also to have a better life with her children now while they are little.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business selling traditional clothing

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara A. is 54 years old. She is married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age.

For about 11 years she has been purchasing young sheep from the local market, fattening them, and then selling them. Dilara is very hard-working, and her diligence is incredible. She looks for ways to provide extra income for her home. Dilara wakes up early every morning to feed her sheep. She is supporting her children with education. She is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy 10 sheep and fodder to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy L., 39, is the mother of one child. She and her husband till a 3-hectare farm where they grow rice. They have been doing this since the start of their marriage. Currently, they have been irrigating their farm. They need additional financial assistance to pay the cost of land preparations.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She plans to buy fertilizer and other farming needs. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve their harvest. 

CEVI helps small business grow. Many people are helped by the its wide range of services such as loans, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farming necessities

loans.name: Đặng Thị

texts.en:
H. Đặng Thị (616971163) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en:
Yetunde lives in Lagos State and she is 40 years old and married with two children. Yetunde sells drinks and wine, and she is also a stylist in her house. She has been in the business for the past ten years.

Yetunde has been borrowing from LAPO for the past year. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more drinks, wine and juice to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Mrs. Imelda J. is 53 years old and is married with five young adult children. The J. family presently reside at Brgy. Lopez Jaena, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Imelda’s business is a combination of a "carinderia" (luncheonette) and "sari-sari" (general) store. For fourteen years now, she has been serving home-cooked meals to her customers while selling to her neighbors a variety of goods including grocery items, school supplies and basic commodities. The business nets on the average, PHP 5,600 per month, which is a big help to the family. Imelda’s one mission in life is to help her husband raise their children well, and provide them with a good education to prepare them to have a better future. Now that her dream that all her children could finish school is within reach, Imelda is working extra hard to expand her business so that she could increase her income potential. The current 13th loan amounting to PHP 19,500 that she is borrowing from NWTF-Project Dungganon will be used buy cooking equipment to expand her food business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy cooking equipment to expand her carinderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Alonso Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Alonso Antonio M. es muy esforzado ya que dedica su tiempo a atender su negocio el cual consiste en un pequeño cafetín donde vende café, jugos, gaseosas y también productos comestibles estando ubicado en una calle céntrica en el departamento de Masaya donde es visitado por los clientes.

Hoy en día, Alonso solicitó un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y los comestibles para comercializarlos y de esta manera continuar desarrollando su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
The young man Alonso Antonio M. is very dedicated since he devotes his time to attending to his business, which consists of a small café where he sells coffee, juices, soft drinks, and also food. The café is located in a downtown street where he is visited by his customers in the department of Masaya. Right now, Alonso is applying for a loan for the purchase of drinks and foods in order to sell them in his café and in this way continue developing his business, which requires the investment so much

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and drinks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace 5 años viene ejerciendo la agricultura, sembrando principalmente papa y en ocasiones maíz. Durante las época de siembra y cosecha toda su familia participa en las tareas y de es necesario contrata a peones. Una vez cosechados sus productos los vende en el mercado local, donde ella misma se encarga de comercializarlos para tener mayores ganancias. Esta actividad permite a Gladys estar en su casa y atender a sus hijos, además que es una fuente de ingresos económicos muy importante para su familia, aparte del aporte de su esposo. Para más adelante, Gladys desea mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas y que su producción sea más abundante. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas ganas de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal, siendo responsable y puntual en sus pagos. En esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para preparar la siembra de sus próximos cultivos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and children. For the past 5 years she has been working in agriculture planting mainly potatoes, and on occasion corn. During the planting and harvest her entire family participates in the work chores, and when necessary she hires laborers. Once harvested her products are sold at the local market, where she is in charge of selling her harvest to earn the best possible profits. This business allows Gladys to be at home and attend to her children, and it also provides a source of income that is very important to her family, aside from her husband’s contribution. In the future, Gladys would like to improve the quality of her harvest and that her production becomes more abundant.

This is the second time that she is acquiring a loan through MFP, for which she has a great drive to continue working in her Communal Bank, and to continue being responsible and punctual in her payments. On this occasion, the money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer to prepare her crop for the following harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y cuatro de sus siete hijos en el sector San Pedro de Sasape, ubicado en el distrito de Illimo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedicó exclusivamente a la agricultura hasta la edad de 30 años. Fue entonces cuando empezó a trabajar como pintor de edificios por recomendación de un amigo y desde entonces se ha desempeñado paralelamente en esas dos actividades siempre tratando de sacar a su familia adelante.

Las actividades que realiza no constituyen una fuente de ingreso consistente. Por lo tanto el desea tener en casa una fuente de ingreso más estable. Ha planeado instalar una pequeña bodega en casa con la cual pueda tener un ingreso permanente. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Manuel siempre ha querido ver a sus hijos desarrollarse por sí solos, por eso trata de facilitarles instrumentos de trabajo con los que puedan ganarse la vida. Desea que su hija se haga cargo de la tienda que planea instalar.

El es un padre muy responsable y que siempre anima a sus hijos a salir adelante. Su más grande anhelo es verlos convertidos en personas honorables y con un futuro prometedor. En la fotografía aparece en el lugar donde piensa instalar su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 57 year old father. He lives with his wife and four of their seven children in the San Pedro sector of Sasape, which is located in the Illimo district 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He worked exclusively as a farmer until he was 30. Then he started to work as a building painter because of the recommendation of a friend. From then on he has worked at both of these activities at the same time. He is always trying to get his family ahead. These activities do not constitute a consistent source of income. Therefore, he would like to have a more stable source of income at home. He has planned to set up a small convenience store in his house. This could give him a steady income. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan of 1,000 PEN. Manuel has always wanted to see his children develop on their own. Therefore, he tries to provide work tools that they can use to earn a living. He wants his daughter to be in charge of the store he is planning to install. He is a very responsible father who always encourages his children to get ahead. His biggest aspiration is to see them become honorable people with a promising future. The photograph is of the place where he plans to install his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products, groceries, and drinks to set up a general store

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Adrian José

texts.es: Comprometido con el bienestar de su familia, el señor Adrian S. ha solicitado un crédito el cual será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para remodelar su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha pasado en mal estado y hoy le es necesario llevar a cabo esta obra de reconstrucción para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus dos niños y esposa. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente porque hará realidad su sueño de tener un local propio que preste las condiciones necesarias para habitar.
texts.en:
In order to improve the welfare of his family, Mr. Adrian S. has applied for a loan which will be used to purchase construction materials to remodel his home, which has been in disrepair for a long time. He needs to finish this project now so that he can offer better living conditions for his two children and wife. This loan will be of a great benefit because it will fulfill his dream of having a place of his own to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Fouina

texts.en:
Fouina K. is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Sataua Uta 1. She is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Fouina owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling cakes in the local community. Fouina has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fouina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fouina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Fouina is now requesting a new loan of 1400 WST which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Fouina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita P. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Perlita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Perlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 26 años, vive con su esposa (Haydee), de 30 años, y con sus dos pequeños hijos; Jefferson de 5 y Renzo de solo un mes de nacido. Juntos, muy contentos y con ganas de salir adelante viven en una acogedora casa que es propia y está ubicada en una apacible zona en la sierra del Perú. 

Desde que era muy pequeño Alberto recuerda cómo sus padres sembraban la tierra en la que él  jugaba inocentemente; desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario que debía saber un hombre de campo. Hoy se dedica a la agricultura y cada día se levanta muy temprano a cuidar sus cultivos de papa y olluco, con cuya venta logra mantener los gastos de su familia.
En la actualidad siembra y también le da mantenimiento a sus tierras, solo y sin ayuda, él considera la labor agrícola muy rentable, ya que la cosecha rinde bastante y además puede poner en práctica los conocimientos que aprendió desde pequeño.
Lo que más desea Alberto es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y a su esposa, quien también lo ayuda en sus momentos libres.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual y responsable en cada uno de sus pagos porque no le gusta quedar mal, ni le gustaría dejar mal a los miembros de su banco comunal, quienes se esfuerzan por mejorar cada día. Con el dinero solicitado tiene pensado comprar abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas para el cuidado y tratamiento de sus tierras para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Alberto is 26. He lives with his 30 year old wife, Haydee, and their two children. Jefferson is five, and Renzo is only one month old. They are very happy together, and they have the desire to get ahead. They live in a cozy house, which is their own. It is located in a peaceful area in the mountain ranges of Perú. Alberto remembers since he was very small how his parents planted on the land where he innocently played. From then on, he learned everything a man of the fields should know. He now devotes himself to agriculture. He gets up very early everyday to take care of his potato and “olluco” (Peruvian tuber) crops. With their sale he is able to pay the family’s expenses. He currently plants and also maintains his fields alone and without help. He considers agricultural work to be very profitable. The harvest produces plenty, and he can also put into practice the knowledge he learned since he was small. What Alberto wants most is to give his children and his wife the best. His wife also helps him in her free time. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual and responsible in each of his payments. He does not like to create problems for the other members of his Communal Bank. They work to improve everyday. He will use the money he is asking for to buy compost, fertilizers, and insecticides for the care and treatment of his land in order to get a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing U. owns a spiritual shop where she sells spiritual items like candles, oils, spiritual books, and other materials. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Blessing is 35 years old and married. She has five children who are still in school and dependent upon her. Blessing is a LAPO client. 

Blessing is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is 25 years old and single. He lives in Kimironko where he owns a shop in which he sells a variety of goods, including food and some cosmetics. Amiel's shop is open 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day.

Amiel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his shop in size and in the quantity of goods he sells so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers.

Amiel hopes that after he uses this loan to renovate his shop and add some additional needed goods, he will attract more customers to buy his goods earn more profits as well. He will reinvest some of his profit in his business and save some for his future, as he is close to getting married.

loans.use: Additional goods, such as dishes

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Одинаев Хуршед проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка а дети учатся. Сам Хуршед более 5 лет торгует. Он продает хозяйственные товары. Хуршед имеет среднее Техническое образование. В свободное от работы время он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
O. Hurshed lives in the Hamadoni region. He’s forty-one years old, married and has four children. His wife is a stay-at-home mom, and his children go to school. Hurshed has been a salesman for over five years, selling household supplies. He has a secondary technical education. In his free time from his primary job, he works as a taxi driver. He is asking for a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Luzonia

texts.en:
Luzonia C. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. Luzonia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzonia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Luzonia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzonia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her sari-sari

loans.name: Birama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Birama N., célibataire âgé de 37 ans est membre d’U-IMCEC depuis Décembre 2009.  Il est prestataire de services (location de chaîne à musique, groupe électrogène….) et commerçant d’accessoires de portable depuis 7 ans. Il gère une cantine et produit  4 à 5 fois dans le mois à l’occasion de cérémonies familiales ou soirées dansante.
Cependant pour les besoins de sa sonorisation et de sa cantine, Monsieur N. souhaitait un prêt de 100 000 FCFA. Ainsi, il pourra avec cet argent acheter un ordinateur à 70 000 FCFA  nécessaire à son travail  de sonorisation  et mettre en place avec le reste de l’argent  une vitrine dans sa cantine pour les accessoires de portables …etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Birama N., aged 37, is unmarried and has been a member of U-IMCEC since December 2009. For seven years, he has been a service provider (renting stereo music equipment, electric generators...) and a merchant of mobile phone accessories. He runs a stall and has four to five bookings a month at family-oriented occasions or dance parties. However, Mr. N.'s sound system and his stall are lacking, so he would like a loan of 100,000 francs CFA. He will then be able to use this money to buy a 70,000 franc computer necessary for his work involving sound systems and to use the rest of the money for installing a glass case in his stall for phone accessories...etc.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stereo sound equipment and more

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with two children. She is a farmer from Kamenka. Tatyana grows early spring vegetables such as tomatoes and radishes. She owns 2 big greenhouses and one separate, spacious greenhouse for seedlings. Tatyana started this business 10 years ago. Presently, she has about 40,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. Annually she spends about 15,000 Grivnyas on seeds and film. 

Tatyana is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 3 rolls of polyethylene film to repair her greenhouse and to buy fertilizers for the upcoming sowing season. Tatyana enjoys learning new things. Currently she is studying in a local college of business and finance to get a degree and to learn some banking and financing principles. Tatyana’s elder son is just about to finish school. Therefore, she is hoping to generate additional income and save some money to help him through college.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, fertilizers and to repair her greenhouse

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Luren.
Claudia es casada, tiene 57 años y 10 hijos, Claudia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en  general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Claudia necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz y cerveza.
Claudia sueña con vender mas productos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Señor D. Luren Communal Bank.

Claudia is a 57-year-old woman with ten children. She runs an in-home store in which she sells general goods, vegetables, and meats every day.

She needs a 1,250.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing sugar, rice, and beer. Claudia dreams of being able to sell more products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and beer

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny I. has successfully harvested sixty sacks of rice from her 2-hectare (5-acre) farm. She wants to make it double and she needs additional capitalization to make it happen.

Jenny has two children and her eldest child is 18. Everything she earns from her farm goes directly towards her children’s needs. She started farming in 1996. Until now, she likes growing rice because it is what sustains her family.

Jenny requested a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. and will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She said, “What I like about CEVI is that they really have a good program that really helps the poor.”

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es: Paulo tiene 32 años, él vive con su esposa  Nika de 27 y su pequeña hija. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años se dedica en la venta de llantas en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Lima, a dos horas de su domicilio. Felizmente las ganancias que recibe son buenas, pues sus dotes de buen comerciante le han dado mucha ventaja en este negocio, además su carisma y experiencia  ha hecho que otorgue a sus clientes los consejos y características apropiadas para comprar llantas. Es por ello que se siente contento y tiene muchas ganas de sacar su negocio adelante pues sabe que tiene un gran futuro, además hay gran demanda en este rubro. Por lo pronto espera abastecerse de esta mercadería y de la mejor calidad. su mayor anhelo es progresar y brindar beneficios a su familia. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprar llantas en calidad variedad para sí lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Paulo is 32 years old and lives with his wife Nika, who is 27 years old, and their small daughter. They live together in their own home. For the past several years, he has sold tires in a central area within the city of Lima, two hours from his home. Thankfully, the earnings that he receives are good and his talent as a good businessman has given him a lot of advantage in this business. In addition, his personality and experience allow him to offer his clients appropriate advice on tire purchase. For this reason, he is very happy and has a great desire to help his business succeed and improve. He knows itt has a great future as there is high demand in this sector. For right now, he hopes to stock up on good quality merchandise. His main goal is to improve and bring the benefits to his family. This is his eighth loan with MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time. With the loan, he will buy a variety of tires and in this way increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on quality tires to improve his sales.

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en:
Salifu is industrious and a resourceful man. He is thirty-nine years old and is responsible for a child who is 12 years old. Salifu is married to a seamstress. He loves selling cereals like maize, the business through which he makes a living for his family. 

Salifu has sold maize for the past eighteen years. His experience over the years on top of his good customer service has made him one of the successful maize traders in the cereal market. He plans to invest the loan to purchase maize in bulk to fill the demand. Salifu is an achiever and his biggest dream is to become a wholesaler of maize.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos su pareja es transportista y la socia se dedica a administrar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes también cría algunos animales menores como son, cuyes, y aves de corral; La socia también prepara gelatinas y hedos artesanales para la venta en su tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería e implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Banco Comunal Virgen Purificada - Angostura (Purified Virgin Communal Bank, Angostura). She lives in the Angostura district, located in Saylla, a province of the Cusco region. Her name is Sonia. She is 31 years old, she lives with her partner and has 2 children. Her partner is a truck driver and she dedicates herself to the managing of her small grocery store and to the breeding of some small animals, such as cuyes (Quechua for Guinea Pigs) and poultry. She also prepares gelatin desserts and artisanal ice-cream to sell them in her shop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core products to furnish her grocery store. She deeply values and is immensely grateful for the loan received, as this will help her improving her business and the quality of her life; at the same time, she commits to repaying her dues respecting the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Edelyn's Group

texts.en:
Edelyn D. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 34 years old. Edelyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Edelyn is married and has four young children. To make a living, Edelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from the selling of fuels (mini gasoline) in the local community. Edelyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2003, Edelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Edelyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase stock to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Edelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family's daily needs. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a weaving  business. She lives in the municipality of Bogo, Argao, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions through her own hard work and with the help of her loans from NWTF. 

By working hard in her  weaving  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9600. Editha is now borrowing PHP 16000 to add to her working capital. This is her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she repaid well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Editha wants to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man and father of three school-aged children. He is from Lebanon and has been working as an experienced car seller for the past eight years. His business consists of buying cars, making the needed maintenance, and reselling them to make a profit. He is thankful for his business income as it helps him to satisfy his heavy expenses and pay for his children's schooling. He offers his customers all types of car and also works on customer request. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to perform maintenance on some cars so that he can sell them as soon as possible and make a good profit from them. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open a used car shop.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a microcredit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance.
At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.
Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their microloan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To perform maintenance on some cars prior to sale

loans.name: Suyapa Ivonne

texts.es: Suyapa Ivonne tiene 26 años, Su actividad económica es la venta de recargas, venta de de Dvd y discos de audio,  ella tiene más de 6 años con esta actividad este no es el primera experiencia que ha tenido con financiamientos pues para ella han sido muy útiles para mejorar su negocio. ella tiene mucha experiencia en su actividad es por eso que se siente muy contenta pues siempre que llegan sus clientes los atiende con mucho cariño y entusiasmo esto es algo que a ellos les gusta muchos. Actualmente con este financiamiento comprara recargas en grandes cantidades nuevas películas y discos.
texts.en:
26-year old Suyapa Ivonne has been earning her living by selling pre-paid phone cards, DVDs and CDs for more than six years. This will not be her first experience with loans as she has used them a lot to help her to improve her business. Suyapa has a lot of experience in this line of work, and she feels very content because whenever her customers visit, she treats them with much fondness and enthusiasm. They like her her service very much. With the loan she plans to buy a large quantity of phone cards, new movies and CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley M. is a 35-year-old married father of five children. He is the sole provider in the family and operates a bakery at his home in Jomvu. He has been in business for the last 10 years, and his business is a success.

This marks Stanley's first loan from KADET LTD., and with the money he plans to purchase ingredients for baking, e.g., flour, margarine, and sugar. He hopes to use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to be successful through KADET loans.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking, e.g., flour, margarine, and sugar

loans.name: Santiaguito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santiaguito lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ligia M. García, de 59 años la cual desde 1992 inicio con su negocio de nacatamales, comida típica que generalmente se comercializa los fines de semana. Ella comenzó con la compra de un cerdo los cuales en ese tiempo costaban 450 córdobas ahora son más caros según comento, además de esto invirtió en una pequeña pulpería.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Luz Marina D. Obando quien desde hace 14 años aproximadamente comercializa leche en Managua y Manuel Salvador Días Urbina quien vende leña. Este grupo ha sido beneficiado tanto con los créditos como por las capacitaciones lo cual le a ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Santiaguito Group is made up of three hard-working individuals. One of them is Ligia M. García, who is 59 years old. In 1992, she started her business selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales, usually made with pork and other ingredients], a typical food generally sold on weekends. She started by buying a pig, which at that time cost 450 córdobas. Now, pigs are more expensive than that. She also invested in a small pulpería [grocery store]. The other members of the group are Luz Marina D. Obando, who has been selling milk in Managua for approximately 14 years, and Manuel Salvador Días Urbina, who sells firewood. This group has benefited both from the loans and from the training they have received. It has helped them to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory C. is from the village of Sto.Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Glory sells vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Glory from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Mary has a business of selling food and charcoal, which she has had for two years. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and food.
