With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and pay fees. In the future, Mary hopes to own a house.        

Mary is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills like salon services.

loans.use: Charcoal and food

loans.name: Mujeres De Paso Correo Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres de Paso Correo” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Limpio.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, algunas van a empezar a emprender actividades independientes con el crédito obtenido por la Fundación Paraguaya.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Gladys es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la compra y ventas de mercaderías  en General. 
Todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 2  hijos y su marido quien trabaja Albañil. 
La señora Gladys solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para poder ampliar su negocio, como lácteos, panificados, enlatados y otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Paso Correo” group was formed with the union of several residents of the city of Limpio.

All of the members of the committee perform independent activities such as sales and preparation of fast food. Some of them are going to begin performing independent activities with the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya.

The members formed a very close group that is capable of carrying out activities together that strengthen their companionship.  

Gladys is one of the committee members. She works buying and selling general merchandise. All of her customers really admire her work. She has a very close family with two children and a husband who works as a bricklayer. Gladys is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise to expand her business, such as dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, and more.  .

loans.use: To buy canned goods, baked goods, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia es agricultora, vive en la zona D. Mallco Rancho localidad ubicada en las afueras D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba a 21 Km  D. la ciudad. Se encuentra casada, su esposo es maestro, que trabaja tambien en la escuela D. la zona, La señora Aurelia tambien cuenta con una pequeña peluqueria actividad que le ayuda a generar ingresos.

La actividad D. agricultura que tiene la señora Aurelia se ha visto afectada por la escasez D. lluvia razon por la que necesita comprar accionpara la perforacion D. un pozo D. agua para riego, ese es el motivo por que solicita el credito.

Al contar con mas agua para su terreno agricola ella podra producir mejor su maiz, cebolla.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a farmer and lives in the Mallco Rancho zone located on the outskirts of Cochabamba city, about 21km from the city. She is married and her husband is a teacher who works in the school in the zone. Aurelia has a small hair-dressing salon which also helps her to generate earnings.

Aurelia's farming business has been affected by the shortage of rain in the zone, for which Aurelia needs to buy labour to drill a water hole for irrigation. This is the motive for which she is seeking a loan. 

When Aurelia has more water for her agricultural land she will be able to better produce her maize and onions.

loans.use: Purchase labour to drill a water hole for irrigation

loans.name: Wabulungu Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
An alcohol sales business is what 42 year old Betty I. has been operating for the last 10 years in Magamaga-Jinja. It is a business this happily married mother of 11 says she began with her own enterprise. Previously, she worked in a cement factory. It was an experience she says she did not fancy that much owing to the low remuneration she was paid yet she put in a lot. Farming was another activity she had a hand in though with time and with reflection, she decided to dispense with.

She mostly sells a local brew popularly known as Waragi which is quite popular with many low rank and file people in Ugandan urban centers. All her kids have been getting an education out of the hard work and effort she has put in in her business. Weekly this business generates her shillings 160,000. With this loan, Betty, who is affliated with Wabulungu Women's group-Jinja, says she is going to buy more jerrycans of crude alcohol for resale and also pay fees for some of her kids.

loans.use: To purchase more crude alcohol for resale and to pay fees for some of her kids.

loans.name: Mujeres  Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Blanca Rosa O. de Candia, que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Ella realizó la invitación y todas encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Urbanas nombrando al Comité Mujeres Activas.
        Las integrantes del comité se dedican a la Artesanía, que es un trabajo que heredaron de sus padres y va pasando de generación en generación.
     Confeccionando hermosas prendas de vestir como ser: camisas, manteles, en aopo´i, también las integrantes se dedican al comercio de productos alimenticios, también productos hortícolas, como así también a la peluquería.
A la misma actividad también se dedica la señora Blanca quein es la presidenta del grupo y trabajado artesana. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas para aopo´i y colorantes para las telas. 

     Las integrantes de este comité agradecen a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido y manifiestan que gracias a ello van a poder seguir trabajando y dándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Blanca Rosa O. de Candia, who lives in the city of Villarrica. She extended the invitation and they all were happy to accept. They formed the urban women's committee called Comité Mujeres Activas [Active Women's Committee]. 

The members of the committee work in artisanal crafts. This is work that they inherited from their parents; it is passed down from generation to generation.         

They make beautiful articles such as: shirts, tablecloths and aopo'i. The members also work in selling food products, as well as produce, as well as cutting hair.    

Blanca works in this same activity. She is the president of the group and an artisan. She is asking for the loan to buy the fabric for aopo'i and fabric dyes.  

The members of this committee are grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have offered and they say that thanks to it they are going to be able to continue working and giving their families a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fabric and fabric dyes.

loans.name: Gamar

texts.ru:
Gamar H.  48 let. Ona zamujem  i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatysa v kolledje. Gamar yeyo muj i deti jivut v qorode Baku. 
Gamar uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u sestri. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Gamar H. is 48 years old. She is married and has three children who go to college. Gamar with her husband and children live in the city of Baku.

Gamar has been in the business of food sales for nine years. She has learned this business from her sister. Right now she needs 2000 AZN to buy foods supplies for resale and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy food for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Rebecca has a business of selling second hand shoes. She has been in this business for 2 1/2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.

Rebecca sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Rebecca has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second hand shoes. She also generates additional income through part time teaching. The main business challenge(s) for Rebecca include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler. Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut K. N. is a 64-year-old woman, married to Hao Chhun, age 66, and they both appear in the picture here. This old couple has seven children, three of whom are single, and the other four are married and live in their own houses. 

She has one daughter who has worked as a tailor in the province of Kompong Cham for many years. Presently, her daughter wants to run her own business, but her savings account is insufficient to make it possible. To encourage her daughter, Nut N. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to buy a sewing machine and some fabric for her daughter as the material for starting her new business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some fabric for her daughter to start her new business.

loans.name: Guisela Ivania

texts.es:
Guisela madre de tres hijos, comerciante de venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace siete años, iniciando con pocos productos con dinero propio que su esposo dio, el cual trabaja como conductor.
Luego busca la alternativa para aumentar las ventas a través de financiamiento en Afodenic aumentando sus niveles de ventas y utilidades. Siendo su decimo crédito.
Invertirá en la compra de ropa escolar como: camisas, faldas, pantalones, calcetines, cuadernos, estuches geométricos, lápiz de colores entre otros. Productos que aumente su volumen de ventas, para lograr cubrir sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Guisela, the mother of three children, has been selling clothes and cosmetics for seven years. She started with a few products, thanks to own funds that she had received from her husband, who works as a driver. Later on, she had opportunity to be granted loans by the microfinance institution Afodenic. She could increase her sales and her profit.

This is her tenth loan. She will use it to buy school clothing and articles, such as shirts, skirts, trousers, socks, notebooks, geometry cases, color pencils and so on. The availability of these articles will increase her turnover and she will be able to meet her payment obligations.

loans.use: To buy school clothing and articles, such as shirts, skirts, trousers, socks, notebooks, geometry cases and color pencils, among others

loans.name: Aidalina Esmeralda

texts.es:
Aidalina Esmeralda M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene una repostería desde hace varios años. Ella realiza desde tortas, pasteles, bocadillos, pan, pico etc. 
M. con el crédito comprará un horno más grande que les permitirá realizar mejor su trabajo en especial los pasteles.
texts.en:
Aidalina Esmeralda M. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has owned a bakery for a few years.  She makes cakes, pastries, sandwiches, bread, and other items.

With this loan, Aidalina would like to purchase a larger oven that will allow her to do her work better.

loans.use: To buy an oven

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi M. lives in the village of Kurdghelauri, Kakheti Region, with his family - his wife, parents and two children: a seven-year-old daughter and a six-month-old son. Giorgi’s wife is a housewife and his parents are pensioners. 

Giorgi’s family has 8 milch cows. Alex – Giorgi’s father is actively involved in the family’s farming activities. Cheese and "matsoni" (Georgian yogurt) produced by the family are sold on the open market in Telavi, a nearby town. Giorgi is a handyman and works on the renovation of houses. 

With the requested loan Giorgi’s family plans to purchase calves, raise them and sell the raised animals after 6-7 months for a higher price. With the gained profit, Giorgi plans to renovate his own house to improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. A. is a 49-year-old mother of three children ranging in age from 10 to 18 whom she and her husband, a farmer, hope to educate to the university level.

Rose's business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega, a rich agricultural area in the western region of Kenya known for its production of sugarcane. For three years now, she has sold cereals, including maize, beans and peas, to the local people. Rose, who works very hard to keep her business doing well, says the business is profitable, but she is faced with the major challenge of financial constraints. She will use her loan of 15,000 to purchase more maize and beans to grow her business.

Describing herself as a visionary lady, Rose hopes to develop her business into a wholesale operation and in the future purchase a plot of land where she will put up rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for her business

loans.name: La Merced (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Merced está formado por 10 mujeres quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades como: comercio, cría de animales, agricultura, etc.  las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Viven por la parroquia de Santa Ana donde su gante es muy amable, gentil y trabajadora.  Esta parroquia es de clima frió y desde donde se puede admirar una parte de la ciudad de Cuenca y también  la naturaleza en todo su esplendor.

La Señora. Rosa Z. vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana.
 
Tiene 33 años, es casada y ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escalita de la comunidad. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país ya que ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo y futuro para su familia. Con el trabajo conyugal han logrado  construir  su casa propia.

Doña Rosa trabaja en una ferretería que es de su propiedad, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos, cuyes, pollos y ganado.

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza del banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para en su ferretería como: cerraduras, clavos, herramientas, material eléctrico, pinturas, mangueras, etc.

Su meta es  construir un local comercial para poner su ferretería.
texts.en:
The community bank La Merced is comprised of 10 women who work in different activities such as trade, animal husbandry and agriculture, etc. that enable them to contribute to the support of their homes and development of their families. They live in the parish of Santa Ana where the people are very kind, gentle and hardworking. This parish is in a cold climate and it is where you can admire some of the city of Cuenca and surrounding nature in all its splendor.

Mrs. Rosa Z. lives in the community of Ingapirca that belongs to the parish of Santa Ana.  She is 33 years old, married and has 4 children, who are  16, 14, 12 and 10 years old.  Her first two children study at school and her two youngest children in the community schoolhouse. Her husband is not in the country, having migrated in search of better work and future for the family. Working together they have built their own home.

For the last two years, Rosa has worked in a hardware store that she owns.  She works Monday through Friday from 7 am to 6 pm. She is also involved in raising pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and cattle.

This is her fourth loan with the community bank and she will invest in buying merchandise for her hardware store such as locks, nails, tools, electrical equipment, paints, pipes, etc.

Her goal is to build a local center to put her hardware store.

loans.use: Buy merchandise like nails, locks, tools, paints, electrical equipment, pipes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food products and used clothing.

loans.name: Miguel Oswaldo

texts.es: Miguel G. de 29 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa y su pequeña hija. Miguel es un hombre trabajador y cada día se levanta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo lleno de  esperanza y alegría. Él se dedica al transporte de carga como: piedras, arena, tierra etc. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad y  se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingreso. Para él la familia lo es todo y es por ella que se esfuerza para poder darles lo que se merecen. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertirlo en su camión,  ya que por el uso se deteriora con facilidad y quiere darle un buen mantenimiento para conservarlo en las condiciones óptimas que le permitan realizar su trabajo con facilidad. Este préstamo lo utilizaría para comprar repuestos como batería, llantas y para la compra de  materiales de mantenimiento así como para resolver problemas del motor, etc. De esta forma espera seguir realizando sus actividades y continuar subsistiendo y luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su querida familia.
texts.en:
29-year old Miguel G. lives in his own house with his wife and young daughter. He is a hardworking man who gets up early every morning full of hope and joy to go to work. His job is transporting cargo such as stones, sand, earth etc. He’s been doing this work for many years and it has become his main source of income.

His family is everything to him, and it is for them that he works very hard to give them what they deserve. Miguel recently decided to seek a loan from Kiva partner Integral to spend some money on his truck which has deteriorated through extensive use. He wishes to give it a good service so that it lasts a long time in good condition. The money will be used to buy parts such as a battery, tires, and other items needed to sort out the engine problems. By doing this maintenance Miguel hopes to continue working so he can provide a better quality of life for himself and his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy parts such as a battery, tires, and other items needed to sort out the engine problems of his truck

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with 2 children  – 1 attends school while the other is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Sofia has been operating a food stall business for the past 7 years, selling from home to her neighbours and school-going children. Sofia faces a major challenge in price fluctuations, preventing her from meeting customer demands. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With this loan for 10,000 Kshs, Sofia wants to purchase bundles of rice, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy rice, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Liliana Maribel

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 26 años de edad  y vive con su novio y sus dos hijos en casa propia ubicada en una comunidad urbana en vías de desarrollo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Esta comunidad tiene como actividad principal la pesca, pues se encuentra en un puerto llamado San José que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque.

Liliana se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace más de 5 años de manera continua, su punto de venta es el mercado Moshoqueque, el mercado popular con mayor regimenes de ventas en toda la región norte del Perú.  

Liliana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar una mayor cantidad de pescado que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas, para en un futuro adquirir su propio local. Así mismo, destinará parte del crédito para uso personal.

Liliana tiene muchos deseos de superación y es una clienta recurrente de nuestra entidad que presenta un buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 26, lives with her boyfriend and their two children.  They live in their own house in a developing urban community that has all of the basic services.  The main business activity in this community is fishing.  The community is situated by a port called San José in the Lambayeque province.

Liliana sells dried fish, and she has been doing this continuously for over five years.  She sells at the Moshoqueque market, a popular market with the greatest sales system in the entire northern region of Peru.

Liliana is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of fish.  This will allow her to increase her sales so that in that future she can get her own place of business.  Part of the loan will be for her personal use.

Liliana has a great desire to succeed.  She is a recurrent client of our entity, and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to have some money for personal use.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a 43-year-old woman who has two boys and two girls, and she is married to a tourism guide.

Three years ago Nariman wanted to make use of her back yard, so she started planting some cactus and other plants as a decoration for their garden, and then she decided to start with profitable business by selling these plants as shown in the picture, also in her house back yard.

Now Nariman wants to add other kind of plants and after that open her own plant store to show and sell her well decorated plants. So that’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy some seeds and plants that are not available yet in her garden.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with five children aged between two and eighteen. She hopes to give her children a good education to university level. Judith sells fish in Kisumu, a business she has been running for four years. She intends to use her loan to purchase more stocks of fish to meet customer demand. Judith hopes to expand her business and become a major supplier of fish in the country. She describes herself as sociable and outgoing.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of corn to make banku.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 40 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 22, 19, 13,  y 12 años, vive en su casa propia junto a ellos. El trabajo de Sara consiste en la venta de carbón y leña los cuales consiguen en un aserradero de la ciudad, vende estos productos en su casa, lleva ya nueve años en este trabajo, actividad que lo realiza sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad de tiempo, para hacer otras actividades. Espera en adelante implementar bien su casa ya que quiere iniciar el negocio de venta de habitaciones, y le falta un poco de inversión para terminar de construir. Este es el crédito número 16 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para seguir adelante con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará madera y carbón para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Sara is 40 years old, and a single mother of four children aged 22, 19, 13, and 12.  She lives with them in her own house.

Sara's work involves selling coal and firewood, which she gets from a sawmill in town.  She sells these products from her home.  She has been doing this work for nine years now, and works on her own.  What she likes about her work is having time available to take part in other activities.  

She hopes in the future to be able to improve her house, and wants to start a business selling rooms.  She needs a small investment to be able to finish the construction.

This is her 16th loan through MFP, therefore she is hoping for your collaboration for her to be able move forward with her goals.  With the requested amount, she will buy wood and coal to keep in stock.

loans.use: to buy wood and coal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, compost, and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Priva

texts.en:
Priva is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, where he has produced milk and vegetables for the last five years. He is 44 years old and married with two children, aged seventeen and thirteen, who are both in school. He gets additional income from his regular employment as a teacher.

Priva has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry for his poultry business. He says that the poultry income will supplement his regular employment income. He believes his family's living standard will be uplifted significantly. He intends to save the poultry income to enable him expand his farming business by venturing into dairy farming in future.

Priva appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services and adds that they cater to small farmers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for his poultry business.

loans.name: 040904-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sáu operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

Sáu is 25 years old and married with two children.

She is the leader of a six-member group, the 040904 Liên Minh Hoằng Trường solidarity group.
 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sáu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sáu has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sáu hopes to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and to buy more land.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elisa has a shop that sells souvenir products like necklaces & table cloths at the same time displays weighing scale for sale. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw materials to make souvenirs to sell.

Elisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат замужем имеет четверых детей. Взрослые дети помогают по бизнесу. У них свой магазин. Семья большая и содержать ее очень трудно. Для этого приходится много трудиться. В магазине они продают товары народного потребления продовольственные и промышленные товары. Магазин очень удобен для клиента, так как у нее они могут найти все. Фарогат хочет пополнить ассортименты своего товара детской одежды, также продукты питания. Она надеется на ваше одобрение и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Farogat is married and has four children. Her adult children help her with the business. They have own grocery store. Their family is large and it's hard to support it and they need to work a lot for this. In their store they sell consumer goods, food and industrial products. The store is very convenient for the customers because they can find everything there. Farogat wants to fulfill the variety of children's clothing and also food products. She hopes for your approval and is thanking you in advance.

loans.use: to buy food products and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 45 years old. She is married and has three children aged 22, 15, and 9. In 2003, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days per week and five hours per day, she supports her family. 
 
She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be used to capture methane in storage tanks. 
 
The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Edison

texts.es: Edison de 46 años de edad es el propietario de un estadero que se encuentra en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar. En esta población vive y desarrolla su negocio desde hace 16 años,  él vende cervezas, gaseosas, jugos y agua; en su actividad le va muy bien y día a día crece su clientela, esto tiene que ver con su cómoda y estratégica ubicación, al lado de un escenario de futbol, en el que todo el año disputan partidos de futbol en varios torneos  y con el buen servicio que presta a sus clientes.  Su meta es lograr apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos  que se encuentran en las edades de 14 y 18 años. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará bebidas y refrescos en mayor volumen y realizará reformas locativas para brindar mayor confort a sus clientes.
texts.en: Edison is 46 years old and is the owner of a booth located in the Puerto Colombia municipality near the seashore. He has lived in this city and started his own business 16 years ago. Edison sells beers, soft drinks, juice and water. In his work, he does well and each day his customers continue to grow. This is due to his convenient and strategic location, next to a football stadium where all year they have matches in different tournaments and Edison offers good prices to his customers. Edison’s goal is to continue supporting the wellbeing of his children who are 14 and 18 years old. This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation; he will buy beverages and soft drinks in greater quantities and make changes to his business which will bring greater comfort to his customers.

loans.use: buy beverages and soft drinks in greater quantities and make changes to his business to bring greater comfort to his customers.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 32 years old and is single. He sells kitchen utensils in a store he has run for six years. 

 Innocent would like a loan to buy more plates, forks, and glasses to increase his inventory. Any profits will be used to build a house. He dreams of one day running a big store selling many kitchen utensils.

loans.use: To purchase home equipment to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Uganda.  She is married and has one child who is not in school.  She has a retail shop business selling used shoes, clothes, and phone accessories.  She has been in this business for four years, and she works six days out of every week. Resty sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Resty has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more airtime (for phones), used shoes, and clothes. 

She also generates additional income through making women's beads. The main business challenges for Resty include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big, to own a fully stocked shop, and to start selling wholesale.

Resty lives in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes, clothes, and phone accessories.

loans.name: Ana Mariela

texts.es: La señorita Ana se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, hace 4 años atrás y este mismo fue heredado de sus padres quienes son de la tercera edad y ya no salen a su negocio, vende por las noches en una d las calles mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba y estudia en el día, tiene una labor muy sacrificada ya que con la venta de comida se paga sus estudios y alimentación y también ayuda a su padres con los gastos dl hogar, se levanta desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para preparar sus alimentos para después ir a sus clases, El crédito lo necesita para cambiar sus utensilios e incrementar sus inventarios en cuanto a insumos se refiere. La casa es de sus padres, la señorita Ana es una persona muy amable y joven que se esfuerza mucho para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Ana has sold food for four years, a business she inherited from her parents who are senior citizens and no longer work in their business.  She sells at night in one of Cochabamba’s busiest streets and studies during the day.  Her work is very demanding but she uses her profits to pay for her schooling and food and also to help her parents with household expenses.  She rises very early in the morning to prepare the food and then go to class.  She needs the loan to replace her utensils and increase inventory with respect to supplies.  The house belongs to her parents.  Ana is a very kind young woman who strives to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy new dishes, pots and supplies.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad, who is a 25-year-old young man, is a father for two daughters. He is a construction worker with a decent salary. 

In order to increase his family income and to improve their standards of living, Fouad has been raising sheep for 5 years. He wants to increase the number of sheep he is raising in order to increase his sales from their products and so increase his income. But since his decent salary he gets from working in construction isn't enough to cover the purchase of sheep and fodder, he needs to take a loan from FATEN for 1,500 USD. Getting this loan will enable Fouad to purchase more sheep and fodder and so increase his sales from their products which will lead to increased income. That will enable Fouad to create better living conditions for his family. Fouad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more numbers of sheep and fodder

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Lorena tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre y se dedica a la preparacion de comidas y golosinas, su negocio opera en su casa de habitación, temprano todos los dias elabora sus comidas, Lorena no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar alimentos para preparar sus comidas y es por esta razón que está solicitando el crédito, compra de productos para la elaboración de las golosinas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Lorena is 40 years old and has a live-in partner. She prepares and sells food and sweets from home for a living. She prepares her dishes very early every morning. However, Lorena does not have the capital necessary to purchase the ingredients to prepare her dishes, which is why she is requesting this loan to buy what she needs to make sweets and meals, thus meeting customer demand.

She needs the profits in order to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase tortillas, pork, beef, chicken, vegetables, cooking oil, rice, beans, lard, condiments, beverages, bread, propane, and water.

loans.name: Ronald Augusto

texts.es:
Ronald es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Ronald no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ronald trabaja como Conserje en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ronald se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que comprara una puerta de fierro para colocar en su vivienda, de esta manera él y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Ronald is 19 years old. He lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and because of the need to work, he could not study towards a professional career, but he would have liked to. In his spare time he likes to listen to music and sometimes he cooks delicious chicken and rice to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Ronald works as a custodian at a commercial business in the city. He works every day for approximately ten hours and believes that it is going well because of his good performance and the kind treatment he gives to others.

Ronald is grateful to Kiva lenders, as thanks to the assistance he can make improvements to his home, as he can buy an iron gate to place at home, so that he and his family will have better security and wellbeing. He will continue working and struggling to achieve his big dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Taddeo

texts.en:
Taddeo is a hardworking man, who has four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to higher levels of learning, and to set up sustainable income-generating activities so as to secure their future.

His main business is shoe-selling, and he also farms to boost his income. He faces a challenge of increased competition, while his dream is to diversify business to include clothes. Taddeo is requesting a loan to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: When the young lady in age of flowers got married because of the financial situation that faced by her family, unfortunately ‎she will be a young victim.  Alaa is a victim to her failed marriage, her husband left her with her one child without any ‎income or money to make her able to provide living for her child. She is 22 years old lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid, ‎and single mother for one kid. Alaa could not complete her education before she got marriage, but after she divorced she ‎decided to complete her education and achieve her dream to graduate and get her bachelor degree, and find a good work ‎with good salary to improve her standards of living and live comfortable with her kid.‎

loans.use: To cover her next semester fees

loans.name: Agnès

texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès A. was born in 1964 in Dalavé (P/Zio). She is married and the mother of two (02) children, with one (01) other child under her care. Her main business is selling coconuts that are used in making palm oil, which is highly valued in Togo. Her husband, a retiree, does not even receive his meager pension, and so Mrs. A. must bear all of the household expenses. However, she has gained a real mastery of her business, which she has been managing for more than 20 years with all the rigor of a responsible manager. Mrs. A. began her business in very difficult conditions, but thanks to her management abilities and especially her business sense, her activities grew to a very encouraging size, requiring additional financing. Her honesty and good faith were demonstrated when she paid back her first credit without any problems. The trust she earned should be worth further financing to expand her business in order to increase her income and improve her living conditions. The $850 credit will thus allow her to buy a large stock from the farms.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agnès est née en 1964 à Dalavé (P/Zio). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et un (01) enfant autre à charge. Son activité principale est la vente des noix de palme qui entrent dans la fabrication de l’huile de palme très appréciée au Togo. Son mari, un retraité, ne perçoit même pas sa maigre pension. Toutes les charges du ménage reposent alors sur elle. Toutefois, Madame A. fait preuve de la maîtrise de son activité qu’elle gère depuis plus de 20 ans avec toute la rigueur d’une gestion responsable. Madame A. a débutée ses activités dans des conditions très difficiles mais, grâce à sa capacité de gestion et surtout son sens d’affaires, son commerce a pris une ampleur très encourageante qui nécessite des financements d’appoint. Son honnêteté et sa bonne foi ont été démontrées lors de son premier crédit remboursé sans difficulté. Cette confiance peut lui valoir d’autres financements pour augmenter ses affaires afin d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer des conditions de vie. Ainsi, le crédit de $850 va lui servir de s’approvisionner en grande quantité dans les fermes.

loans.use: Buying and selling coconuts

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan was born in 1975. She sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Thuan’s husband is a farmer who has 1500 square meters of land, where he has been growing vegetables for 6 years. They have a daughter and a son. The daughter is a ninth grade student and the son is a second grade student. Their income is $10 per person/month. It is difficult for them to keep their children in school. They need a loan for $75 in order for them to purchase various fruits and vegetables for the shop and to continue growing vegetables on their land. They are going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her shop at the local market.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur M. is 35, he is single and a very successful businessman. In 2001 he opened a men's store in the Sabirabad bazaar. He is planning to rent a place in the center bazaar and open his branch store there. He applied for a $1200 USD loan to help him improve and expand his business.

loans.use: Mr. Mehdiyev would like to open a branch store of his successful men's clothing store in the central bazaar.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar I. is a 37-year-old farmer who runs his own small farm with a little herd consisting of two cows and a calf. Yadigar lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Khochonbli village near Imishli town. Since 1993 when he fled to Imishli from Jabrail during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict, he has been an internally displaced person. Yadigar is married and has one child.

He started his business in 2000, when he borrowed money from his friends and purchased a cow. Later, when he had paid back the debts, the cow began to bring him income and in less than a year, he was able to purchase one more cow and a calf.

When his child was born, life become more difficult so Yadigar has decided to expand his business and purchase another cow and fodder for his cattle for winter. He has applied for a loan of US$ 900. He intends to purchase a good milk cow for about $730 and for the remaining $170, he will purchase fodder.

loans.use: purchase one cow and fodder for winter

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
The wish to move ahead is an important reason for doña Antolina to have started the breeding of small animals, in spite of having many obligations at home taking care of her children and husband.

This activity has allowed her to obtain an extra income and contribute to the welfare of her family as it does not demand much time away from home and she can still take care of her chores and family. Her previous job away from home caused family conflicts, but now she is very happy and satisfied with her new occupation.

The breeding of pigs and sheep has become an important part of the family income and therefore she wishes to increase the number of animals with the purpose of improving the quality of life of her young children, who are all of school age. She asks for $100 to purchase a pig. Let us help Antolina so she can have more animals and that way ensure the future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Los deseos de salir adelante se han convertido en una importante razón de existencia para Antolina, que a pesar de tener muchas obligaciones en casa, con el cuidado de sus hijos y esposo a podido iniciar la crianza de animales pequeños. Esta actividad le ayuda a obtener ingresos interesantes para contribuir con el bienestar de su familia y debido a que su desempeño no le demanda mucho tiempo ha continuado con el diligente cuidado de su hogar; debido a que su labor anterior fuera de casa ocasionó muchos conflictos familiares ahora está muy contenta y satisfecha con su nueva ocupación. La crianza de cerditos y ovejitas se ha convertido en una importante fuente de ingresos y por esta razón desea aumentar el número de sus animalitos con el propósito de seguir incrementando la calidad de vida de sus pequeños hijos que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar. Solicita la suma de 100 dólares para adquirir un cerdito más. Ayudemos a que Antolina pueda tener más animalitos en bien del futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a pig

loans.name: Govher

texts.en: Govher M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar. She started her business ten years ago. She wants a $1000 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou N., 42, works with her husband, 45, as brokers buying rubber from the growers and then reselling it, making collectively on average $8 a day in revenue.

This couple has four children. Two children assist in selling rubber with their parents and the other two are enrolled in school.

This couple hopes to use this loan to expand their inventory by purchasing more rubber to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more rubber to meet her growing customer demands

loans.name: Cristina Francisca

texts.es:
Preparing and selling flour tortillas is a common business in Nicaragua. Mrs.Cristina M. has been doing this from a very young age in León and has sold many tortillas over the past 48 years in the Estación market. Very early in the morning she sells these delicious tortillas for her eager clients.

Being an elderly lady, Mrs.M. is having a difficult time moving the tortilla mix from the flour mill to the market. She needs to hire someone to assist her and has to increase her production to offset the incresed costs. To increase her production she wishes to purchase more raw materials.

Ceprodel has helped Mrs.M. over the past two and a half years with 17 micro loans that she has used to purchase raw goods which are transformed into flour tortillas. She now needs the loan to pay a young assistant that transports the tortilla mix from the flour mill to the market. Mrs.M. is a mother of four but unfortunately they have all moved away as all of them are married and have children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lukoto East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah K.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to add to her business and increase stock. Sarah is married. Her husband has a maize milling business. She has 7 children ranging from age 12 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Harriet K. and Jamila N.. Harriet K. has a business selling bananas and wants to boost business. Jamila N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand vegetable business and make more profits

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ecery J.. She is currently in the business of building and is requesting a loan to buy building machinery. Ecery is 31 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 1 school going daughter aged 12. Each week, Ecery makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her personal needs and save the rest. Ecery has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy a commercial motorcycle and the loan was paid back on time.

Ecery is joined in her small group by Jesca K., Betty B. and Beat N.. Jesca K. has a business running a retail shop and grocery store and wants to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Betty B. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Beat N. operates a retail shop business and wants to buy more crates of sodas.

loans.use: To add to building business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and is a single woman. Mary is a fish seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 5am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Argentina Joao

texts.en:
Argentina is 29 years old and originally from Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland. Argentina is married and has 2 children: Humberto, who is 8 years old, and Wagner, a newly born baby boy of 2 weeks (in the picture with Argentina).

Argentina has lived all her life in Boane, a village close to Namaacha and 30 km away from the capital city, Maputo. She studied until 10th grade and than pursued a technical course of 30 months to become a nurse. She completed the course in Maputo at the Science Instituto of Maputo and was awarded the equivalence of a secondary degree diploma. Argentina has been a nurse at the Health Centre of Matola 2 (a neighborhood of Boane) for the last 4 years and is proud to help improve her neighbors' quality of life. She works Monday-Friday from 7:30 am to 3:30 pm and has a monthly salary of MTn 4,200 (around US$172). The government increases the salary every year. This year they have promised an 11% raise, but as Argentina only has a secondary level degree, she will have a lower raise in her salary. Argentina is now on her 2-month maternity leave and will also stay an extra month home using her year’s vacation days. Argentina’s husband works as an electrician and helps pay the expenses.

This will be Argentina’s first loan ever. She decided to approach Hluvuku after talking to a friend and realizing she could speed the dream of concluding the cement fence around her house. The MTn 15,000 will be used to buy construction material such as cement and blocks and also to pay the construction worker.

In the future Argentina would like to ask for another loan to expand the house and provide more comfort for her family.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. T. Thi Tran has been a participant with the Fund since 2000. Before joining the Fund the family’s income depended mainly on working the fields. After joining the Fund, Ms. Tran has discussed with her family regarding using the loans to invest in retail businesses and opening a restaurant to serve the people in the neighborhood. Ms. T.’s house is in the center of the town, so she has many advantages in business endeavors. Everyday her husband goes to buy food from large retailers for her resell and serve the customers. Thanks to her husband’s help and her determination, the business has improved and become more stable day by day. Since receiving more income from the business, she has saved up money and built a nice 2-story house and bought some other conveniences for the family. In this round of funding Ms. Tran would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest more in the store to better serve the customers, increase profit, improve the family’s income, and provide for her two children to attend school. The family’s income is about 3,500,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Thủy là thành viên của Quỹ tình Thương từ năm 2000. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu là từ làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Thủy đã bàn bạc với gia đình vay vốn để đầu tư vào việc buôn bán, mở hàng ăn phục vụ bà con trong xã. Nhà Chị Thủy nằm ở Trung tâm xã do vậy chị gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi trong kinh doanh. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua đồ ăn từ các đại lý về để chị chế biến bán cho khách hàng. Nhờ có sự giúp đỡ của chồng và bản chất chịu thương chịu khó của người phụ nữ công việc làm ăn của chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn. Từ khi có thêm thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán chị đã tiết kiệm và xây được ngôi nhà hai tầng khang trang và mua sắm thêm một số tiện nghi trong gia đình. Vòng vốn này Chị Thủy muốn vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng nhằm phục vụ khách hàng tốt hơn để tăng thu nhập, phát triển kinh tế gia đình, đầu tư cho 2 con ăn học. Thu nhập 3.500.000/ tháng

loans.use: expand store

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia baji, the wife of Mr. Z., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan since her childhood. She owns a three-room mud house and is the mother of two sons. Her elder son, Ali Raza, is 5 years old and in kindergarten. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Her husband is a fruit seller and now she is applying for a loan to buy more fruit for his business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Maryam baji wants a loan for her shoe business; Shamshad baji wants to buy wood for her furniture business; Suraiya baji wants to purchase a sewing machine, while Samina baji wishes to buy fruits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon N., age 28, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she and her husband, Kong Va, age 55, have sold chickens for a living, and are able to earn up to US$6.50 of profit per day. This couple has two children together and all of them are too young to attend school. Mrs. Phon told a loan officer that she wants her children study until they get a bachelors degree.

Mrs. Phon N. would like a loan of US$1,000 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase more chickens to sell.  (Mr. Kong is pictured because his wife was not available.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken to sell.

loans.name: Afefa

texts.fr: Afefa S. est revendeuse de pagnes et des bijoux depuis 7 ans à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 32 ans, Afefa est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle souhaite par ce crédits acheter des pagnes et des bijoux pour la revente. Elle désire aussi faire des livraisons en gros. Afefa est une fidèle cliente de FECECAV car elle est à son troisième crédit et les remboursements sont toujours réguliers
texts.en:
Afefa S. has been a seller of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and jewelery for the last seven (7) years, in the small village of Adeta which is located 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Afefa is married and is the mother of three (3) children. With this loan she would like to buy decorative cloth and jewelery for resale. She would also like to make wholesale transactions. Afefa has been a loyal customer of FECECAV. This is her third loan and her loan payments have always been on schedule.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and jewelery for resale

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Ever tiene 40 años de edad, su esposa es modista , con tres hijos de 8,12 y 14 años de edad, los tres están estudiando, don Ever tiene 40 años de edad y se desempeña trabajando como capitán de mesa en un restaurante lo cual tiene ocho años de experiencias, toda los días llega noche a su casa ya que el restaurante se llena mas por la noche abecés animado por las propinas que los cliente le dan, otras cansadas por el desvelo. Con la solicitud del préstamo  quiere meter las aguas negras y comprar dos puertas para su casa, para estar más higiénico y seguro con su familia. A largo plazo es poder tener las condiciones para seguir mejorando su casa, tener un negocio propio y poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ever is 40 years old. His wife is a dressmaker, and they have three children—ages 8, 12, and 14—all of them in school. Ever is the head waiter at a restaurant where he has worked for 8 years. He arrives home late each night, since the restaurant is busiest at night—some nights Ever comes home feeling inspired because of the tips that his customers have given him, while on other nights he feels tired from the long hours. With the loan he has requested Ever would like to install a sewer system and purchase two doors for his house so that his family can have a safer and more hygienic home. His long-term goal is to be in a situation where he can continue improving his house, have his own business and be able to help his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making repairs and installing a sewer system

loans.name: Dotse

texts.fr: Dotse T. est âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteurs de taxi moto depuis 2 ans à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Sa moto ayant servi durant deux années, elle paraît usée, et monsieur Dotsè souhaite par ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto pour relancer son activité.
texts.en:
Dotse T. is 41 years old, married, and the father of 2 children. He's been a motorcycle taxi driver for 2 years in Wome, a village northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. His motorcycle has been in use for two years and appears used up. Mr. Dotse is therefore seeking this loan to buy a new motorcycle in order to reinvigorate his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is divorced with a teenage son. It has been difficult for her to raise her son all by herself and provide for all the needs of a growing guy. She knew she had to find ways to generate enough income for their needsm  so she decided to launch her cafeteria business 6 years ago. She establish a policy of offering nutritious, high quality, and affordable meals to all workers in the industrial area where she runs her business. 

Svitlana is hoping to purchase groceries for the winter season. Assorted merchandise will give her a chance to offer additional affordable dishes on the menu and please her customers’ tastes. 

Svitlana is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivna and is hoping to repay it in 6 months. One of her long-term plans is to remodel her private apartment and purchase the facility she currently rents for her cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for cooking

loans.name: Rasheeda Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda baji is a 33-year-old married lady and resides in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is N. and he has a ready-made garment sales business. He runs a shop in the main bazaar of Kot Radha Kishan and sells his garment collection. His collection attracts a pack of people and forces them to buy it.

Rasheeda baji has no children. She helps her husband by buying some of the garments in the community. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institution of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to re-sell.

She is the group leader for a few more women from her locality. Zareena baji and Mussarat baji each want a loan to buy beams for their shuttering business. Rukhsana baji and Ghulam Fatima baji want a loan to buy buffaloes for their milk-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to re-sell

loans.name: Sabohathon

texts.ru: Бободжонова Сабохатхон проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 39 лет, разведена и имеет троих детей. Живет в трудных условиях , так как приходиться много работать , чтобы обеспечить своих детей. Работает на рынке. Занимается торговлей одежды уже три года. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabohathon B. lives in Yavan town. She is 39 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. She lives in difficult conditions and has to work hard in order to support her children. For the past three years she has been selling clothing at the local market. She would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow and purchase more goods for sale. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal, se llama "WAYNA CAPAC", Este nombre responD. a uno D. los herederos del trono  Inka, quién en su gobierno extendió el imperio D. los Inkas a su máxima expresión, lo llamaron "el granD."; El banco, está ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba que corresponD. al departamento del Cusco, exsactamente a 1 hora y 30 minutos D. la ciudad, este sector es denominado el valle sagrado D. los Inkas, lugar D. tierras generosas y fértiles permitiendo así la producción D. granos grandes y ricos.

Los socios integrantes D. este banquito D. 09 mujeres y 05 varones, es gente emprendedora deseosa D. que la sociedad les brinD. un mínimo apoyo para poder seguir llevando el sustento a sus hogares y seguir la tradición D. los cultivos como en la época D. los antiguos peruanos, los Inkas. Estos socios se dedican a actividades diversas, en su mayoría son agricultores, ellos producen hortalizas organicas, maíz, habas, cebada, alcachofas, papas, granos secos, entre otros productos, para lo cuál desean invertir sus préstamos en la mejora D. su materia prima que son ls granos y compra D. animales mejorados, ya que también se dedican a criar animales menores como son, pollitos, pavos, patos, cuyes, conejos D. castilla, para finalmente hacer que se procreen y venderlos; otros socios aperturarán algunos pequeños negocios, como abrir un restaurante D. comida rápida, sandwich, jugos, venta D. salchipapas.

Estos socios agradecen la ayuda recibida y se comprometen a devolver el préstamo en el plazo indicado, ellos realmente valoran el apoyo dado, por que en las zonas rurales D. Perú, no se cuenta a menudo con la facilidad D. banca financiera social.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Wayna Capac." This is the name of one of the heirs of the Inca throne, who in his governance extended the Incan empire to its maximum extent; he was called "el granD.." The bank is located in the province of Urubamba, which is part of the department of Cusco, exactly one hour and 30 minutes from the city. This sector is called the sacred valley of the Incas, a place of generous and fertile lands, thus allowing the production of large, rich grains.

The associate members of this small bank of nine women and five men are enterprising people, desiring that the association offer them minimal backing in order to be able to continue supporting their families and to continue the tradition of cultivation as in the time of the ancient Peruvians, the Incas. These associates carry out various activities, the majority of which are agricultural. They produce organic vegetables, corn, beans, barley, artichokes, potatoes and dried grains among other products. For this reason they desire to invest their loans in the improvement of their raw materials, which are the seeds, and in the purchase of better animals, as they also raise small animals such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, guinea-pigs and rabbits in order to ultimately breed and sell them. Other associates will start some small businesses, such as to open a fast food restaurant, selling sandwiches, juices and kebabs.

These associates are thankful for the help received and undertake to repay the loan by the proper date. They truly value the support given, because in the rural areas of Peru, you often can't count on the help of the financial social bank.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw materials, small animals and various products.

loans.name: Maria Calixta

texts.es: La Señora María Calixta S. tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es casada. No tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de leña y frijoles cocidos. Hace más de treinta y cinco años que se dedica este negocio Doña María inicio esta actividad por su Mama por lo que esta es una buena fuente de ingresos y le gusto mantenerla. Los propósitos de Doña María son de mantener su negocio por que es la única manera para sobrevivir de su familia. El financiamiento es utilizado para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de productos como leña, cuajada y carne. Sus deseos son de establecer otro negocio para conseguir ingresos extras para su familia. La cantidad es de C$ 8.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Maria Calixta S. is 52, married and does not have children. Maria sells firewood and cooked beans. Maria has had this business for more than 35 years. She started the business for her mother because it is a good source of income and she would like to keep it. Maria intends to maintain her business as it is the only way for her family to survive. The loan will be used as working capital to buy firewood, cheese and meat. She wants to establish another business in order to gain additional income for her family. The loan requested is C$8,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es:
El socio MIGUEL ARCANGEL; nació en la bella provincia de Urubamba, el vive en el barrio de callejón chico en tarabamba, a 10 minutos de la provincia.

El socio Miguel, tiene 44 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos de (22,21,10) años, el está separado de sus esposa; El socio tiene como principal actividad el comercio de maderas, el trae desde la selva de Perú madera hasta su provincia, para venderla al por mayor a las diferentes carpinterías de la zona, para lo cual el socio requiere el préstamo, el desea invertir en la compra de un porcentaje mayor de madera.

El socio agradece y valora el esfuerzo por este medio y se ratifica en el pago de sus cuotas, hasta el pago total del préstamo.
texts.en:
Member MIGUEL ARCANGEL was born in the beautiful province of Urubamba and lives the small town in Trabamba, 10 minutes away from the province.

Member, Miguel is 44 years old and has 3 children, ages 22,21,10. He is separated from his wife. He is in the timber business and he bring wood to his province from the jungles of Peru in order to sell them at wholesale price to different woodshops in the zone. This is why he is requesting a loan. He hopes to invest it in the purchase of a large quantity of wood.

Member Miguel is thankful and values the efforts made here. He agrees to pay fess and the entire amount of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by SANDY JUAREZ, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell timber wholesale

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fried chicken. She hawks her fried chicken from street to street within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria.She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more fried chicken to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fried chicken to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván N. es un joven soltero que es maestro en una escuela que se dedica que estudiante aprenda un buen porcentaje de ingles. El con el tiempo que ha trabajado fue apto para poder adquirir una casa de interés social, pero la casa se queda sola cuando el sale a trabajar; por que también trabaja como DJ en un antro de la ciudad y no quiere que al momento de no estar en su vivienda le puedan robar lo que con mucho sacrificio a comprado. El desea poner protecciones en las ventanas para que ningún delincuente pueda pasar por alguna ventana y llevarse algo de valor.
texts.en:
Iván N. is a young bachelor who is a teacher in a school where he works so the students learn a good percentage of English. With the time that he has worked, he was able to acquire a house through public housing, but he leaves the house only when he goes to work; because he also works as a DJ in a dive in the city, and he doesn’t want anyone to be able to rob him of what he has bought with so much sacrifice the moment he is not in the house. He wants to put protection on the widows so that no delinquent would be able to enter through a window and take anything of value.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To protect Ivan's Home

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia Y. is a 35 year-old divorced restaurant operator who currently lives with her parents, along with her two children who attend the local school.  Felicia understands business ethics and knows that customers are her income so she provides good quality and excellent service.  She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is generally eaten with different kinds of soup.  Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper sauce or soup.  Felicia has attracted lots of customers with her tasty meals, and it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in her food delivering service.  Also, Felicia says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to help meet her production costs.  She will use the loan to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare her meals.  She would be grateful for such assistance.  Felicia belongs to the village bank called ‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 


Гайрат мужчина – кредитор в организации несколько лет. Он сам работает специалистом в юстиции города Худжанда. Кроме этого он имеет бизнес продажи велосипедов, вешалок для одежды, маленьких телевизоров. Он привозит товар из Китая , раз в  месяц или раз в два месяца. Он хочет на полученый кредит привезти ещё телевизоры и магнитофоны.
texts.en:
Gairat is a man who has been taking out loans with our organization for several years. He works as a specialist in the justice department of the town of Khujand. Besides that he has a business selling bicycles, clothes hangers and small television sets. He brings the merchandise from China once or twice a month. He wants to use this loan to bring in more televisions and music players.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of bicycles and other items

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora O. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Dora sells provisions at Brofoyedur in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a mobile phone dealer. 

Dora uses her income to support her husband with housekeeping expenses. Dora will use the loan to purchase provisions in bulk for retail. With the new profit from her expanded business, Dora plans to invest in the children so that they can gain a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase provisions in bulk for retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of timber in bulk

loans.name: Lesbia Mercedes

texts.es: Lesbia Mercedes R. Carrión tiene 45 años. Es una mujer casada. Ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que desde muy joven ha trabajado. Y fue su Mama quien le enseño esta actividad económica  y agradece mucho porque fue el único medio de vida que encontró para obtener ingresos humildemente. A pesar de enfrentar desafíos como mantener el negocio en estos días tan difíciles. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, vestidos.
texts.en:
Lesbia Mercedes R. Carrión is 45 years old and a married woman. She has one child left at home. Her business is buying and selling new clothing. She has been doing this for more than ten years.

She is a very hardworking woman and she has been working since she was very young. It was her mother that taught her the business and is very thankful that the only way of life she knows is working hard for her modest income. In spite of facing challenges like keeping her business running in these difficult times she continues to work.

She needs the loan in order to buy shirts, pants, and vests.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shirts, pants, and vests

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en:
Mary W. is 48-years-old, married to Raphael W. and they have two children namely Irene and Margret. She has operated the eggs supply business for the last seven years. Mary operates her business in a densely populated and easily accessible area and she relies mostly on wholesale customers who then sell in retail to other shops.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing group in KADET. With the loan she is borrowing from Kadet she intends to open another eggs supply depot and with the extra profit Mary plans to purchase a pickup so as to make her work easier.

Her hopes and dreams are enlarge her business and enter new markets, she believes she is forward looking and hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya

loans.use: The client Intends to open another eggs supply depot.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David vive en casa propia con sus hijas esta separado de la esposa hace varios años su vivienda queda en la calle José Saravia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz , la actividad que el realiza es la confección de parcas, chamarras, buzos, mochilas, según el pedido , instalo un pequeño taller en su domicilio pero trabaja solo, en algunas ocasiones contrata dos o tres personas, el crédito que solicita es para comprar material.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien, también es parte de Kiva y puede obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
David lives in his house with his daughters. He has been separated from his wife for years. His home is on José Saravia street in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. He tailors parkas, jackets, jumpers, and backpacks on request. He has a small workshop in his house and works alone. On some occassions he contracts two or three people. The loan is he asking for is to buy material. He is a member of Impro and repays loans very well. He is also part of Kiva and can obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying material

loans.name: Enrrique Manuel

texts.es:
El socio Enrrique, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene  52 años de edad,  es soltero y se dedica a muchas actividades pero entre la principal y la que le ha dado logros y beneficios económicos es la venta y  distribución de  libros, nuestro socio lleva a ofrecer sus diversos libros por casas, instituciones y demás lugares dónde la gente se interese en la compra de algún ejemplar y los deja a cuotas, de modo tal que mensualmente él vuelva para cobrar las cuotas hasta que estas se cancelen, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para adquirir algunos nuevos libros y también para uso personal, cubriendo sus cuotas con su trabajo de distribución de libros.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Enrrique, belongs to the communal bank "Líderes del Tercer Milenio" and lives in the city of Cusco. He is 52 years old, single, and makes a living through many activities.
